@@2907442 <p> Apologies to IO for starting new threads after posting only a couple of parts , but previous threads have been getting so many comments I 'm afraid that updates to the story might get missed . <p> BOUND <p> My breathing quickened as I tried to fight back my rising fear and panic . Fortunately I was n't claustrophobic or I 'd really have been freaking out , but being bound , blindfolded , and locked in a closet was like nothing I 'd ever experienced before . All kinds of thoughts raced through my head . What if there is a fire ? What if Barbara falls down the stairs and breaks her neck , who would release me then ? What if Barbara is lying and leaves me here all night ? <p> I finally forced myself to take some deep breaths to try to calm down . None of those things are going to happen , I told myself . Barbara will be back soon to free me . She would n't allow anything bad to happen to me . It took a few minutes but @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ a yoga class in college which had also taught meditation techniques and I began to apply those now . I tried to empty my mind and focus on my breathing and the movement of my body . Every time a stray thought entered my head I gently pushed it aside and returned my focus to the movement of my chest , shoulders , and stomach with each breath . I 'm not saying I reached a state of tranquility or enlightenment or anything , but at least I was able to eventually calm down enough to start thinking rationally about everything that had transpired . <p> It 'd all started last night when Anna 's mom had showed up at the apartment - was that really less than 24 hours ago ? - and had continued to build from there . After that had been the police , the lovemaking with Anna , the order this morning by Barbara to move into her condo , Kelly 's confession of her involvement in my recruitment , and finally my confrontation with Barbara . <p> Confrontation ? I had to laugh at @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ if I did n't have a gag in my mouth . It had gone about as well as Custer 's confrontation with the Sioux at Little Bighorn . What in the world had possessed me to think I could possibly win that battle ? Had I subconsciously decided to force Barbara 's hand with its inevitable outcome and subsequent punishment ? <p> A thought suddenly entered my head : I 'm here because I 've chosen to be here . I tried to push it aside . That 's not true , I told myself . I 'm here in this closet - bound , gagged , blindfolded , and locked up - because Barbara forced me into it . <p> No , I 'm here because I 've chosen to be here . The same thought kept returning until I stopped fighting it and decided to examine it . Could it be true ? In terms of the immediate past I knew it was . Barbara had given me the choice today of walking out the door - in fact , had practically dared me to do it - @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ . And every step along the way after that - from the gagging , to the whipping , to the binding - she had asked my consent first and I had granted it . <p> I went farther back now , all the way to that very first meeting in this office . I could have easily walked out then when I first heard about the Mailgirls program . After that came signing the contract , Tokyo , the revelation I was going to be a mailgirl , signing the nudity waiver , and finally agreeing to move into Barbara 's condo . Every step along the way I 'd had opportunities to change course , and every time I 'd chosen the path that led me here . <p> There 's no doubt that Barbara had done everything possible to stack the deck in her favor , but that did n't change the fact that I 'd always had a choice . I still do . After Barbara releases me today I could go straight down to HR to sign my separation papers , then leave and never come @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ would n't do that . I did n't want to . Barbara had known that all along . <p> I thought back to my life right before all of this had happened . It had been a good life . I had friends , an interesting job with a vibrant company , and was on a career path I believed would lead to success . When I thought about it , though , in comparison to the craziness and intensity of my life now , it just seemed so normal and conventional . So ... vanilla . <p> If I could somehow step out of this closet and go back to that life as if none of this had ever happened , would I do it ? As I focused on that question I realized that I would n't . The past two months had unlocked cravings and desires within me that I 'd barely known existed and it would be impossible for me now to go back to that life , at least not until I 'd fully explored those desires . The future that Barbara described for me @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ found it terribly exciting . Everything , that is , except remaining indefinitely as Barbara 's virtual slave until she decided to release me . <p> I had absolutely no intention of signing another contract after this one expired . Even if I wanted to continue my life as a mailgirl I would do it as a free agent who could walk away at any time without penalty . Barbara had seemed confident , though , that I would sign another one and that made me nervous . I 'm sure she believed she could find enough leverage to get me to do it , and I knew better than to underestimate her . Continuing down this path would be treacherous , but knowing that only made it even more exciting . I 'd have to be wary to escape any future traps she had planned for me . <p> I thought about the potential of Barbara turning me into a sex slave for the executives on the upper floors and immediately dismissed it . She 'd promised to protect me in exchange for my obedience , and I believed @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ , because she 'd proven repeatedly that she was n't . No , I believed her because I knew that Barbara considered me one of her possessions now , and she always took care of her possessions . Everything that belonged to her - from her condo , to her clothes , to her car , to her office - were always immaculately maintained . She would no sooner allow the men upstairs to defile me than she would allow one of them to take a dump on her carpet or smoke in her car . <p> On the other hand I knew that Barbara would probably choose to use me sexually herself . It had already begun today . It 's something I had mixed emotions about , but the prospect of being forced into sex by a beautiful and powerful woman also excited me . It was another thing I 'd have to talk to Anna about , though . I 'd decided I was n't going to keep anything from her . <p> For the first time I had finally decided to accept and embrace my true @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ there all along , but without someone to force me to test my barriers I 'd always retreated back into the relative comfort of " normalcy " at the first sign of risk . With Barbara in charge , though , I crashed through those barriers like I was onboard a runaway diesel truck . There 's no way I was going to jump off of this ride right now even though I knew it might well crash and burn down the road . <p> My thoughts were interrupted by the sound of a key turning in the closet door lock . It startled me because I had n't heard Barbara return . I felt her hand gently stroking my hair for a few moments , then she began wordlessly loosening the ropes . After freeing me she helped me to my feet and guided me , still blindfolded and gagged , back into the office . My legs felt wobbly , like a newborn colt 's , but Barbara kept an arm around me to help me maintain my balance . " Kneel , " she commanded , and @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ gag , then held out a bottle of cold water and let me sip from it . When I had finished she screwed the cap back on and stood above me . <p> " Now tell me everything you experienced and thought about in there , " she commanded . " Everything . And Class 2 offenses such as public defecation , which are deemed mere " quality of life " issues . They now carry no fine and a max 60 days in jail . <p> Denver might want to look up New York Citys experience with mere " quality of life " issues before Rudy Giuliani became mayor in 1994 . <p> Mark Silverstein , legal director for the American Civil Liberties Union of Colorado , explains the real reason behind the changes : " Many times it becomes a deportable offense if you 've been convicted of even a minor ordinance violation that 's punishable by a year in jail . " Go put away your MMU , take a shower and meet me in the executive parking lot in thirty minutes , " she said , then turned and walked away before I could respond . <p> For Barbara to seek me out like this rather than summoning me to her office was very unusual and a sudden unease came over me . Had Barbara found out ? Already ? <p> Yesterday , a week after my first phone call with Mariko @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ back there . " Tell me everything you have seen and heard as a mailgirl relating to company business , " Mariko had told me over the phone . " Do not concern yourself about whether it is important or not . I will decide what is worthy of passing on to Mr. Hiromoto and what is not . " So I 'd spent nearly thirty minutes telling Mariko everything I 'd learned about DDE 's projects and plans , both rumored and real . I knew some of it was dated information that had already been made public but I also told her things I knew were privy to only a few people at the highest level . Many executives and managers loved to make us lowly naked mailgirls wait while they were on the phone or discussing business with colleagues in their office and they thought so little of us that they had no concern about what we might see or hear . <p> I thought that I 'd feel some sense of shame or guilt about passing on DDE secrets to a foreign company but afterwards I @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ I 'd been a mostly willing participant since becoming a mailgirl I had n't forgotten the lies and deceit that had been used to lure me into this life in the first place . DDE had cynically turned a bright , well-educated young woman with a promising future into a naked delivery girl and I no longer felt any loyalty to the company whatsoever . <p> What did concern me , though , was Barbara finding out about this and what she might do to me if she did . Mariko had said that my visits to that office would never be recorded on my log but Barbara always seemed to know everything . I told myself that she was n't omniscient and could n't know everything going on in the sprawling DDE complex , but now she had suddenly broken from routine in ordering me to meet her and that had me worried . <p> Back in the Mailgirls locker room I quickly showered and re-applied my makeup , then made my way toward the executive parking lot beneath the tower wearing only the metal collar that was now @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ waiting for me as I entered through the door that led into the parking area . " Follow me , " she ordered . <p> It was mid-afternoon and no one else was in the lot as she led me to her car , a black Lexus sedan . The side windows of the car were tinted and I could see a mirrored image of myself in them as I approached . It still struck me as odd whenever I caught a glimpse of my nude body in public places and saw what others were seeing . <p> Barbara unlocked the doors with her key fob . " Get in the back , " she ordered . I opened the car door and saw a towel on the seat , placed there presumedly to protect the leather from my lady juices . Next to it was what looked like a folded black scarf . I crawled into the back seat and shut the door as Barbara got in up front behind the wheel and turned to look back at me . " Buckle up and tie on the blindfold , @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ tied the black scarf around my eyes . <p> I heard the engine fire up and felt the car begin to move . My uneasiness continued to build as the muted sounds of city streets and traffic reached my ears . Once again Barbara was ripping me out of my comfort zone and taking me on a journey into the unknown . <p> Comfort zone . Those words probably do n't really accurately describe any aspect of my life since meeting Barbara . Equilibrium might be a better description . Barbara always allowed me time to find a tenuous sense of balance before giving me another shove past my boundaries . This blindfolded car ride with no explanation about where we were going was something new and different and I was beginning to tremble with fear and anticipation of what might lie ahead . Would she order me out of the car somewhere in the middle of town to humiliate me in front of a bunch of strangers ? Would she abandon me to find may way back home , naked and alone ? Barbara turned off the engine and , without saying a word , exited the car and shut the door . I was left alone as I heard the electronic click of the door locks . My anxiety continued to escalate with each passing minute as I fought off the urge to lift the blindfold to try to see where I was . For all I knew Barbara was standing right outside of the car watching me to see if I would do that . <p> Finally I heard the sound of footsteps approaching . @@2907457 <p> is the culmination of my seven-year odyssey to understand the origin of a mysterious symbol that first appeared on a highly controversial , century-old artifact called the Kensington Rune Stone . <p> The discovery of the meaning of the Hooked X was stunning , as was the secret history behind it that gradually unfolded during my quest to learn more about that history through research . This journey has been nothing short of amazing as it winds through the mysterious worlds of the medieval Cistercians , the Knights Templar , and modern Freemasonry . <p> The story begins with the discovery of a 202-pound stone unearthed by Swedish immigrant farmer named Olof Ohman , who was clearing trees in preparation for farming back in 1898 . The slab of graywacke contained a lengthy inscription carved in Norse runes whose message has only been recently deciphered accurately . In 2005 , I co-authored a book entitled The Kensington Rune Stone : Compelling New Evidence that presents a large body of evidence that conclusively proves the artifact is indeed a fourteenth-century document . <p> The Hooked X picks up where that @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ Minnesota to the New England Coast , where four more medieval rune stones are found . The trail then leads to a mysterious round stone tower in Rhode Island that could only have been constructed by a highly controversial group from Europe before the time of Christopher Columbus . The story that unfolds behind the Hooked X shatters many historical and religious paradigms and ultimately reveals the startling untold history of North America . <p> Holy Grail in Americais a two-hour documentary film which premiered on History Channel on September 21 , 2009 . Committee Films produced the film chronicles the author 's nine-year pursuit of the origin and meaning of the enigmatic Hooked X symbol . This research delves deeply into the unknown and mysterious world of European visitors to North America prior to Columbus.http : **26;423;TOOLONG <p> Many people in the Western world are familiar with what is known as the Trinity , the Christian concepts that the Almighty shows itself in three forms : The Father ( God ) , the Son ( Jesus ) , and the Holy Spirit ( the invisible energy of God that @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ , people have started to see that this " Holy Spirit " may in fact be the feminine aspect of the Almighty , making for a complete universal family of Father , Mother , and Child . <p> But such a view has been , for a long time , considered heretical and at odds with orthodox teachings of Chrisitianity . Goddess worship is strictly forbidden , for God is a man and Jesus Christ is a man , and only men can be priests and women must suffer for what Eve did . And yet , in spite of these social dogmas , there were still people , men , who believed that women deserved a higher regard , especially in the realm of religion . Amongst the most famous of these groups , the Knights Templar . <p> There is a symbol known as the Hooked X. It is said to be a version of an ancient Swedish rune , yet such a symbol never existed in those ancient times . However , the Knights Templar who were friends of the Norse may have created this symbol . @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ " The Hooked X : Key to the Secret History of North America " , geologist Scott Wolter is certain that this symbol is of Templar origins . And for those familiar with " The Da Vinci Code " by Dan Brown , one knows that the Templars regarded the feminine just as sacred as the masculine , and made heavy use of symbolism and allegory to both hide and impart truths . <p> Ancient symbolism used triangles to denote gender and their related aspects . An upwards facing triangle encompassed the male aspect of the universe . A downwards facing triangle , the female aspect of the universe . The letter X features both , with the center of the X being that brief touching point of these two aspects , these two worlds , where all energy accumulates , and life as we know it is created . <p> Now , for the Hooked X - the top half of the X , or the feminine half , features within itself yet another feminine triangle . It is smaller and within the larger feminine . Could this be @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ with the Templar tales of the Holy Grail would know that the Templars believed that Mary Magdalene was the wife of Jesus and she bore his child , a daughter named Sarah . <p> The Hooked X would seem a Templar symbol of what can be called the New Trinity : the Father , the Mother , and the Daughter ; Jesus , Mary Magdalene , and Sarah daughter of Christ . Such an emphasis of feminine divine is indeed Templar . <p> If the Trinity of the Heavens is " The Father , The Mother , and the Son " , and Earth is the opposite of Heaven , it would seem to follow that the Trinity of the Earth is " The Father , the Mother , and the Daughter . " And Jesus proclaimed that the Kingdom of God is here now . Perhaps this new world indeed calls for a New Trinity . <p> Interview with Scott Wolterauthor of The Hooked X : Key to the Secret History of North America . Scott 's journey has been nothing short of amazing as it winds through the @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ , and modern Freemasonry . The story that unfolds behind the Hooked X shatters many historical and religious paradigms and ultimately reveals the startling untold history of North America.Geologist Scott Wolter has authored eight books and has been president of American Petrographic Services since 1990 and is responsible for the independent petrographic analysis testing laboratory where the Kensington Rune Stone was brought for investigation in 2000 . He 's been the principal petrographer in more than 5,000 investigations throughout the U.S. and around the world , including the evaluation of fire damaged concrete at the Pentagon following the attacks of September 11 , 2001 . Wolter and his wife , Janet , have two children , Grant and Amanda , and live in Chanhassen , Minnesota . <p> 1 . Hooked X Two ( two images side by side ) - Photos - Coast to ... @@2907458 <p> Several of you also seem to have problems with the cats ' diets or digestive systems . <p> Siamese cats , for reasons not totally understood by vets , enjoy a slightly longer lifespan than your average domestic housecat. 20 years is not uncommon for a Siamese , whereas maybe 15-16 years is more like it for your tabby . <p> As cats age , one of the health risks they encounter is kidney failure . It is a natural part of aging . Cats typically do n't have heart attacks or strokes - but if they live long enough , they may well go into kidney failure . <p> I 'd start looking for symptoms at around age 15 . They might include stomach sensitivity , lethargy , increased water drinking , slimming/thinning . <p> As the kidneys begin to shut down , a cat ca n't process protein ( which should normally make up the bulk of its diet ) in the same way that it always did . <p> Your vet can monitor kidney function via bloodwork . And all cats should get " well kitty @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ have agreed ( for a lot of good reasons ) not to over-vaccinate . In a geriatric cat , kidney function is just one thing to be sensitive to . <p> A diagnosis of Chronic Renal Failure is serious - and has to be taken seriously . However , with proper care , your cat might still live an additional 2 years or so . Proper care will probably include subcutaneous fluids , a changed ( reduced protein ) and special diet , possibly acid reducing medications , possibly appetite stimulants . <p> Chronic Renal Failure is irreversible and a " wasting " disease - so at some point , you and the cat have to figure out whether euthanasia might be the best alternative . And you have to be prepared for that - also how much time/effort you are willing to devote to " proper care " to extend the cat 's life . <p> CRF is something any geriatric cat ( age 15 or so onwards ) should be closely monitored for . Please discuss in detail with your own vet . <p> For those of you @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ the small extra sum of money for cancer coverage , from an earlier age than you might think is necessary . Though I am pretty sure ... more <p> If a cat is diagnosed with CRF at age 10 , then rather than being age-related , I would suspect another cause - such as dental problems . I think dental issues are at the root of many potentially fatal ... more <p> I lost a siamese at age 12 . She had routine checkups , good teeth and still went into kidney failure . @@2907474 <p> Richard - There survives a letter , written by Zikir-iliu a Kassite ambassador at the Assyrian court of ulmanu-aared or Tukulti-Ninurta , which reports the use of chariots in this region . 500 troops of the ( Sutu ) Hirana had joined with a troops of the Hasmu and Kipi-Aur ( probably Qipi-Aur the sukkallu rabi'u and father of Aur-iddin and grandfather of Ili-pada ) was pursuing them with 100 chariots . ( O.R . Gurney , " Texts from Dur-Kurigalzu " , Iraq 11 ( 1949 ) 131-149 ) . <p> Just been reading some old posts and some papers sent to me by Herbert Storck . One 2007 paper on the battle of Nihriya and the corpus of Assyrian-Hittite letters by Jacques Freu seems to retain the old identification in the Upper Tigris basin ( " La bataille de Nihrija , RS 34.165 , KBo 4.14 et la correspondence assyro-hittite " , ? Tabularia Hethaeorum : hethitologische BeitrSge ; Silvin Ko ? ak zum 65 . Geburtstag Groddek , Detlev . Harrassowitz , 2007 p. 271-292 ) . BTW Freu also agress with Singer ( as against @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ as you all know I say it was ulmanu-aared ) . <p> Some other comments on the location of Nihriya include two in the north-west Upper Balih - Wolfgang Rllig ( near Urfa ) and Jared Miller ( Kazane Hnynk - unlikely as the site ended around the time of Hammu-rabi - so meets the Old Assyrian and Old Babylonian references but not the Middle Assyrian/Urartu references ) . Finally there is Massimo Forlanini ( Tell Lidar - in " +tapes et itinTraires entre Assur et PAnatolie des marchands palTo-assyriens : nouveaux documents et nouveaux problFmes " , KASKAL , Rivista di storia , ambienti e culture del Vicino Oriente Antico 3 ( 2006 ) 147-176 ) . This is much further west than I would place it , being on the Euphrates , 11 kilometers upstream from Samosata ( Kummuh ) . <p> Forlanini accordingly places the town of urra , to where the Assyrian pulled back form Nihriya , near modern Hilvan ( again too far west from my point of view ) . For Singer and those who place the battle of Nihriya in the Upper Tigris @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ middle Tur Abdin . The location of a urra near the Upper Balih has been the one thing that I have not be able to identify but Forlanini paper refers to a letter written by ami-Adad to his son Yamah-Addu , during a campaign in the area , in which he advises his son to abandon ur'a as it is not defensible and to transport its grain to Nihriya and to proceed to Heum ( which Forlanini identifies with Kisas 7 km east of Kazane Hnynk - which Forlanini plausibly identifies with ubat-ama ) . Wherever this ur'a is , it shows that a city of this name was close to Nihriya . <p> Returning back to Freu 's paper mentioned at the top of this post . After reading it I now accept that the Hittite letter KBo 18.25 - see Stephen 's LONG ... late . I have been assigning it to Tudhaliya and Tukulti-Ninurta and seeing it as formalisation of a return of cities once conquered by ulmanu-aared ( during and after his Nihriya campaign , which also included IMO a crossing of the Euphrates led by @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ reign boasted of the event as if it occurred at the beginning of his reign ) . From Freu 's partial translation , I now follow him and assign it to a letter from uppiluliama , son of Tudhaliya , to Aur-nadin-apli , son of Tukulti-Ninurta . Freu 's translation of the relevant passage is " Tukulti-Ninurta returned them ( the cities ) to the king of Karkemi when he had come to the city of Uaukanna ... When your father had come , he gave these localities to the king of Karkemi . " . So , as before , Tukultu-Ninurta did return cities to the King of Karkemi , only now Freu 's translation makes it sure that this letter was written to a successor of Tukulti-Ninurta and that , in the past , both Tukulti-Ninurta and the king of Karkemi ( probably Talmi-Teub ) had met together in Waukanni . <p> Freu also lists three letters as belonging to the correspondence between uppiluliama and Tukultu-Ninurta . KBo 28.61-64 , an Akkadian letter sent by Tukulti-Ninurta , in the time of limu Ili-pada ( see again Stephen 's @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ the content of this letter . He says " The king of Aur recalls the crisis that had shaken the Kassite dynasty for several generations so as to justify his conquest of the Kardunia kingdom to which Tuthalija and his sons , by his own admission , had not opposed . The sender of the message admits to the loss of Babylon and solicited the support of the Hittite king against a new enemy , the " prince " of the land of Suhi , the centre of dispersion of the Ahlamu / Arameans located on the middle Euphrates . " . A second Akkadian letter KUB 3.123 , probably from Tukulti-Ninurta , has only preserved the salutation " uppiluliyama great king , king of the land of Hatti , my brother " . The third letter KUB 57.8 is written in Hittite but the addresser 's name is in Akkadian " uppiluliyama king of the land of Hatti " and mentions several countries ( Amadana , Lulluua ) in which the king of Assyria had campaigned . He concludes that these letters show that under uppiluliama and Tukulti-Ninurta both @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ uses as an argument against those who originally assigned KBo 4.14 ( and some still do ) to the time of Arnuwanda or uppiluliama . <p> " Freu also agress with Singer ( as against Dietrich ) that Tukulti-Ninurta was the victor at Nihriya ( as you all know I say it was ulmanu-aared ) . " It appears to me that there are two separate battles ... more

@@2907476 <p> But documents obtained by the city show that as early as 2009 , developers and city building inspectors knew the tower was settling faster than expected . " faster than expected " ! ! ! It should not settle AT ALL . It should be anchored to stable bedrock as is done in New York . In the absence of available supporting rock , it should not have been built . <p> Anyone in San Francisco who has even glanced at the news lately knows three things about the Millennium Tower : That its sinking and tilting , that its foundations do not extend to bedrock , and that its fantastically expensive . <p> ( Everybody knew the latter point already . ) <p> The next question is what kind of design plants a 58-story tower on sand ? <p> Well , intrepid Iowa State University architectural design professor Tom Leslie ( who noticed the buildings woes after reading the recent New York Times story ) has now explained it via the simplest analogy possible , that of a mere stick . <p> The Concrete Steel Reinforcement Institutes case @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ building , rather than the more popular steel designs used in most San Francisco buildings ) says that the Millenniums foundations rest on 950 friction piles . <p> A friction pile is simply a long , cylinder-shaped construction shoved into the ground , with the weight of the building on top of it . The Millennium Tower piles are roughly fourteen inches to a sidewhich may not sound very big relative to the frame , but remember that there are almost 1,000 of them . <p> This Norwegian University of Science and Technology paper explains that if the piles are n't  long enough to touch bedrock , they rely on the friction of the surrounding soil for support ( hence the name ) . What does that mean ? Leslies stick explains it all : <p> " Imagine driving a broomstick into sand . You can only go so far before there 's enough broomstick in contact with the sand to put up fearsome resistance . " Eventually , even all of the pressure you can muster wont push the stick in any further . <p> And that 's the principle that 's @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ weight ( 14,000 pounds per square foot , according to CSRI ) , distributed over the 950 piles , contested by the resistance of the soil against those piles , all sitting in a big , giant , concrete-framed equilibrium . <p> except on bedrock . Nothing else will support them stably . The Laws of Nature are not amenable to change because of economic reasons . If you are telling me that people are stupid enough to ignore this ... more <p> Do you really think it is POSSIBLE to demolish MOST costal cities ? In the real world ? Many coastal cities are also on rivers . They are built on flood plains . Hundreds of feet of nothing but silt ... more

@@2907480 <p> It turned out to be a much longer journey than I ever imagined when I first started this but here ( finally ) is the conclusion to Danica 's tale . I hope you like it . - Seahawk <p> A BRIEF CELEBRATION <p> Dan Evans stood at the end of the conference table with pen in hand to sign the new contract extending DDE 's North American Mailgirls partnership with Hiromoto Industries for another five years . A company photographer who 'd been summoned to the room snapped pictures as Evans inked his signature onto the paperwork , then handed the pen to Mariko who did the same . Then the two of them posed together for more pictures as the others in the room broke into applause . <p> Kelly and I watched all of this from our knees , the naked embodiment of what all of the dry language and legalese in the contact actually produced in the real world . We 'd been stripped of our clothes , our names , and most of our rights as employees , and the goal was to create @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ After a round of handshakes and some small talk , Evans turned to Mariko . " I 'm pretty sure the lawyers still have some mop up duty left to do on the paperwork so how about joining me and Barbara in my office ? I 've got some champagne on ice to celebrate the occasion . " <p> Mariko smiled and bowed her head slightly . " Thank you Mr. Evans , " she replied in her accented and formal English . " I would be most pleased to join you . Perhaps we can also invite these two mailgirls so that they may serve us ? " <p> Evans turned and looked down on us . " Sure . Great idea . " <p> Barbara also gave us a look but it was hard to tell what she was thinking . I had n't seen her since that fateful meeting on Monday and now I felt a flood of conflicting emotions . Despite everything , I still had strong feelings for her and felt guilty knowing that I 'd asked Mariko to bring her down . She 'd @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ This is the only way out , not only for me but for Kelly . The die had been cast so there was no turning back now anyway . <p> Kelly and I followed Dan , Barbara , and Mariko out of the conference room onto the tenth floor of the tower . This was the home of the company 's top executives and had once seemed like a magical place to me that must be filled with extraordinary people . I 'd been here enough now as a mailgirl though to know the truth : the people here were n't particularly special . There were some intelligent , highly productive people working on this floor but there were also fools , sycophants , and insufferable assholes . They may wear more expensive clothes and make more money but they were n't necessarily smarter or harder working than the people doing the less glamorous grunt work elsewhere that was vital to DDE 's success . <p> The sight of a couple of naked , collared women obediently following behind their elite corporate masters would have once created shock waves on @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ . In just two short years Barbara had thoroughly changed the culture here at DDE , turning something that had once been unthinkable into an organic part of their business environment . This represented a preview of the seismic cultural shift that Barbara hoped would spread throughout American society . <p> The five of us entered Dan Evans ' office , a large luxurious suite befitting the CEO of a multi-billion dollar company . On the right side of the office near a large window overlooking the city was a leather sofa and chair surrounding a coffee table . Barbara and Mariko settled onto the sofa while Evans took a seat in the chair . I 'd been carrying Barbara 's laptop bag and placed it onto the floor next to her . " Pour the three of us champagne , " she ordered . <p> " Yes , ma'am . " <p> On a nearby bar a bottle of Dom Perignon was chilling in an ice bucket . Kelly popped the cork and poured the expensive champagne as I held the glasses . After serving them we were ordered @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ 's hand into mine . " Here 's to a long and successful partnership , " Dan Evans said as the three of them raised their glasses , clinked them together , and took a sip . <p> " It 's a shame Mr. Hiromoto could n't make it , " Dan said to Mariko . " I was looking forward to meeting him . " <p> " Mr. Hiromoto sends his regrets he could not come , " Mariko replied . " At his age he no longer desires to make such long journeys . " <p> " Yeah , I do n't blame him . How old is he now , if you do n't mind my asking ? " <p> " He is 72 now . <p> Wow ! And he still works full time ? " <p> " Yes , " Mariko replied . " Mr. Hiromoto has no desire to retire to a life of tending his garden . " <p> " He 's still as strong as an ox , " Barbara interjected . I remembered my lone meeting with the man when I @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ did seem remarkably fit for his age . <p> " Yes , he remains in very good health , " Mariko said . She took another small sip of her champagne and then placed the glass on the coffee table . " Please excuse me but there is a subject I am required to bring to your attention . I have been compelled by Mr. Hiromoto to pass on a request from him once our negotiations had concluded . " <p> " Sure , " Dan said . " What is it ? " <p> " Mr. Hiromoto requests that Ms. Anderson sign a two year Mailgirls contract . " <p> " Um ... what ? " Dan laughed , not quite sure of what he 'd just heard . " Is that a joke ? " Barbara simply stared at Mariko with a puzzled look on her face . <p> " No , it is not , " Mariko assured him . " He believes Barbara would be a more authentic spokesperson for his program in the future if she has served as a mailgirl . " I felt @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ her . She had a smirk on her face . <p> " He 's serious then ? " Dan replied . " Mr. Hiromoto really wants Barbara to work as a mailgirl for two years ? " <p> " Yes . He wishes to purchase Barbara 's contract and bring her to Tokyo to work for him . " Kelly squeezed my hand again as a stunned look came over Dan 's face . <p> Barbara had been uncharacteristically quiet but she finally spoke up . " Mariko , please pass my apologies on to Mr. Hiromoto but I simply can not work as a mailgirl in Tokyo or anywhere else . I have many duties here that go well beyond my work in the Mailgirls program . " <p> " I understand , " Mariko replied , then opened her stylish handbag and retrieved her smartphone from it . " Mr. Hiromoto has provided me with a video that he believes may help persuade Ms. Anderson that becoming a mailgirl is the best course of action . I am afraid my phone has a very small screen . Is @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ screen ? " <p> " Sure . Let me see your phone , Mariko , " Dan said . His tone remained polite but I could tell he was becoming perturbed by the direction of this conversation . Barbara , for her part , was n't showing any emotion but I could tell the wheels were turning in her head trying to figure out what Mariko was up to . <p> Dan spent a couple of minutes with Mariko 's phone before handing it back to her . " I 've downloaded and set up an app you can use to play it on the TV , " he said pointing to a large flat screen television on the wall opposite the sofa . " Just select the video file and hit play . " Then he got up from his chair , retrieved a remote from his desk and turned the TV on . <p> " Thank you , Mr. Evans , " Mariko smiled . Seconds later a video began playing on the flat screen . It took me a couple of seconds to realize what I was @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ How in the hell did Mariko get this ? <p> ENDGAME " What the f*ck is this ? @@2907482 <p> Jeroboam was not married to Jezebel . She is a later figure in the history of northern Israel . Her marriage was with Jehoram ( I ) the son of Ahab . <p> Not only 1 Kgs. 9:10 but verse 1 also implies that the Ark was not deposited into the Temple until after Solomon completed Jerusalem . The second apparance of the Lord to Solomon , according to the biblical writer , was in response to Solomon 's prayer in 1 Kgs. 8 . If the Ark was deposited in Year 12 it took another 12 years for the Lord to tell Solomon his prayer was heard because the second vision comes after Jerusalem and the royal palace were completely finished according to 1 Kgs. 9:1 . The LXX is explicit . It says the Ark was deposited into the Temple after Solomon finished his 20-year construction work in Jerusalem . <p> The names Tahpenes in the MT and Thekemina in the LXX are believed to be the same appellative and not a proper name . They are both considered renderings of the Egyptian title T ' , @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ In cuneiform the Hurrian equivalent of the Egyptian title is Dahamunzu ( Da-ha-mu-un-zu-us ) of the " Deeds of Suppiluliuma " ( KBo V 6 iii 8 ) . <p> Kitchen has a long footnote on this in TIPE , p. 274 , n. 183 . My own opinion is that the Greek Thekemina might well be a transcription of the Egyptian T ' , hm(t)-nsw ( although Albright believed that Thekemina stood for " The Concubine of Min " ) but Tahpenes is not . There is no similarity with T ' , hm(t)-nsw unless one emends the Hebrew so that the consonant /pe/ is replaced with a /mem/ . Also , Tahpenes is probably not an appellative meaning " The King 's Wife " since the lady Tahpenes is already given a title in 1 Kgs. 11:19 ( " the queen " ) . <p> As to identity , the lady Tahpenes was married to a pharaoh of the late 21st Egyptian dynasty whose reign spanned probably the entire second half of David 's 40-year reign and also the early years of Solomon . Once again I am @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ the Edomite to encompass at least two different pharaohs : Amenemope and Siamun . He asserts that Amenemope was the pharaoh who gave asylum to Hadad as an infant and that when Hadad grew up he acquired his Egyptian wife from Siamun . <p> According to the biblical narrative , the same pharaoh who offered political asylum to the infant Edomite heir was the same pharaoh who opposed his later decision to return to Edom after the news of David 's death . The question put on the lips of pharaoh by the biblical writer of 1 Kgs. 11:22 " What have you Hadad lacked with me that , behold , you seek to go to your own country ? " is a reminder of the great favours Hadad found in the court of this same pharaoh , and these are described in vv. 19-20 . There is no hint of a change of ruler in Egypt between those verses and vv. 21-22 and if there had been a change the question asked in v. 22 would be out of context as it would presuppose additional favours not mentioned in @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ credit for the actions of his predecessor -- and I know that 's not unheard of in Egypt . These alternatives complicate an otherwise simple and straightforward narrative and they therefore fall under Okham 's razor . <p> In my opinion Tahpenes was the queen of Psusennes II , the last king of the 21st dynasty , on the assumption that Africanus ' version of Manetho is incorrect in saying Psusennes II reigned 14 years only . I go with Eusebius here because a reign of 35 years is enough years to cover the second half of David 's reign and the early years of Solomon . I figure that if Siamun made a military expedition against enemy Sea-peoples ( cf. A Malamat , BA 21 1958 , p. 99 ) on the coast of Philistia this could have paved the way for Psusennes II to capture Gezer a little further inland on the frontier between Philistia and Israel as a dowry for his daughter . If Psusennes II was the pharaoh who opposed Hadad 's return to Edom according to 1 Kgs. 11:22 it may have been because he @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ Solomon , or was in the process of doing so . <p> On the question of Hadad 's sister-in-law Tahpenes and Jeroboam 's sister-in-law Thekemina being one and the same queen , I note that the LXX has it that Hadad married an elder sister of Tahpenes . This is not in the MT . Jeroboam married the oldest ( not elder ) sister of Thekemina , Ano . This too is not in the MT . If Tahpenes and Thekemina are the same lady with two older sisters one of whom was married to Hadad at least 3+ years before Solomon became king ( because the child Genubath was weaned by Tahpenes ) and the other was married to Jeroboam no earlier than Solomon 's 24th year ( because Jeroboam fled to Shishak no later than Solomon 's 24th year ) then Jeroboam probably married Ano well into her mid-to-late forties . <p> Could Ano still give birth to Abia at that advanced age ? Could the same Tahpenes who weaned Genubath before Solomon became king survive her first husband , marry the new dynast Shishak , and still @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ of this is impossible and if Tahpenes was a very young queen when Genubath was born her older sisters may not have been much older and all three ladies could still be in their late teens before Solomon came to the throne . If such were the case Ano need not be over the childbearing age when she married Jeroboam sometime after Solomon 's 24th year . But then an 80-year reign for Solomon is simply out of the question . This is obviously a mistake on the part of Josephus or his copiers . <p> Greetings All I 've followed the discussion , but there 's one thing that seems not to have been said -- and that 's whether or not the 1 Kings account was redacted in antiquity to shorten the narrative ... more <p> Thank you for your reply , Tory . @@2907485 <p> Anyone here remember their annual school physicals ? To this day , I still cringe at the memory for various reasons . In my home country , we used to have at least one every year ( two if you count the sports check up ) . Ours could be really embarrassing , because they were usually unannounced and we often had to take our medical in the same room as the boys . <p> It always started out the same way . First , we were ushered in two lines into the change room , where two nurses got us ready for our medicals ; girls on the right side and boys on the left . This was where things started to get kinda weird . The boys only had to remove their shirts and singlets , but we had to strip all the way down to our panties . I 'm not exactly sure why this was , but I clearly recall the nurse telling us to take off our vests along with everything else . Looking back , I think there must have been an unofficial @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ was no partition in the room at that time , so the boys got to see us undressing on the other side of the room . After we 'd taken everything off , we had to fold our clothes in a neat piles and leave them on the wall side bench . It 's hard to describe how embarrassing it was , standing there in nothing but our undies , waiting for the doctor to call us into the clinic . All of my friends agreed it was n't fair that the boys got to keep their most of their clothes on , while we had to mill about in our panty-pants . <p> When the Doctor was ready to see us , the boys sat down on the left side while the girls were told to line up and wait their turn . The " clinic " was at the far end of the change room , a brightly lit space with a table , some chairs and a set of scales . There was also a folding screen next to the doctor 's chair , in case anyone @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ most of my friends , I was blushing to my hairline and trying to hide my underpants by crossing my hands in front . I 'd shown up to work still feeling the aftereffects of my drinking session at Hooligan 's the night before and racked up more demerits in one day than I usually did in a week . At least I was n't feeling hung over today but I remained an emotional train wreck , still reeling from that fateful meeting in Barbara 's office on Monday . <p> I stripped and handed my clothes and sandals to Tanisha to be locked up and she strapped an MMU to my arm . Anna did the same and also had a metal collar displaying the number " 1 " locked onto her neck . Our nudity , the electronic leashes in the form of the MMU 's , and our metal collars were meant to remind us , and everyone else , of our status as company slaves . Once stripped of any sense of dignity and normalcy the two of us headed up the stairs to the Mailgirls locker @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ Diana and Kelly were already there when we arrived . We exchanged some small talk but there was n't much beyond that to say to each other . Nothing had really been resolved on Monday night other than the promise that the four of us would keep our eyes and ears open for anything we might be able to use as ammunition against Barbara . <p> The remainder of Diana 's training had been reassigned to Anna so I 'd be working a normal shift today , not that the word " normal " could ever really describe mailgirl duties . I 'm not sure why Diana had originally been assigned to me on Monday . Most likely it was just another of the head games that Barbara loved to play with me . Maybe she somehow knew that I 'd once been a " Bixby Girls " fan and wanted show me that she even had the power to strip and humiliate one of the icons of my youth . That might even be why she hired Diana for the role in the first place . " Who the @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ I 'd grown tired of trying to unravel the reasons behind Barbara 's torturous plots and schemes . <p> I went through my daily ritual of preparing for my shift in front of the unseen audience on the other side of the mirror , a process that made me feel like a combination of entertainer and zoo animal . My body held no mysteries for anyone employed at DDE but I still felt the inevitable stirrings of arousal knowing I was about to put it on display once again for hundreds of clothed people . I 'd never become jaded about my constant public nudity and I was actually grateful for that small gift since it appeared now there would be no end in sight to it . <p> My morning started out fairly routinely as I made my pickups and deliveries . I was familiar now with every inch of DDE 's vast complex just as its inhabitants were familiar with every inch of my body . In my role as a lowly servant girl the best that I could usually hope for these days in an interaction with @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ . More likely , though , it would involve some combination of rudeness , condescension , or undisguised lust as they demonstrated their superiority over me . For my part , I had come to accept this degradation with submissive deference . <p> At one point during the morning , while kneeling on a Mailgirls mat between runs , I overheard someone say that a team from Hiromoto Industries had arrived this morning to finalize the extension of their Mailgirls deal with DDE . Anger surged through me as I thought about Mr. Hiromoto 's betrayal and Mariko 's apparent complicity in it . I could n't help but wonder if they were here , though , or if I would see or talk to Mariko . I was n't sure I even wanted to anymore or what good could come of it if I did . <p> If there was one thing the drinking session at Hooligan 's had done , though , was help diminish my feelings of being adrift and alone . Kelly , Anna , and I had re-established the bond that had once been so @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ the tower . Diana , even though we 'd just met , also felt like a part of my " crew " now , even managing to win Kelly over by the end of the night . <p> And although Lin 's current duties and responsibilities had kept the two of us from talking much lately I knew she was another person I could trust . She once told me that she 'd kept working naked even after being promoted to lead programmer of the upcoming " Mailgirl 9 " game out of solidarity with me , although I was pretty sure it was mostly because she got off on it . Her job did n't require the same rules and restrictions as being a mailgirl so she was still the same filterless chatterbox as always , never shy about letting her bosses and co-workers know her opinions even as they stared at her bare tits . I resolved to try to find a way to talk to her by the end of the week . After that I 'd be totally under Barbara 's thumb and it would become @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ other mailgirls , I now considered Anna , Kelly , Lin , and Diana to be my inner circle , people I could trust in the days to come . The meeting with Barbara had snapped me out of whatever spell I 'd been under and I 'd finally come to understand that the life that she had planned for me was a path of self destruction . But did this realization happen too late to matter ? If there was a way out I just could n't see it . <p> My morning runs continued , up stairs and down , through corridors , past cubicles and offices . DDE 's Mailgirls program , after two full years , had become a well-oiled machine and I was just one of its cogs . <p> The program had taken over the actual mailroom now so every package or piece of mail coming into or leaving the complex was handled by a mailgirl . There were currently thirty mailgirls serving more than three thousand employees working in the vast complex , not to mention a growing number of tangos who would @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ their six weeks of training . <p> Information now flowed far more swiftly and efficiently throughout the complex than it ever had before while the company 's productivity , morale , profits , and stock price had never been higher . Employee turnover , among both men and women , was at an all-time low . The presence of beautiful nude women in an otherwise normal business environment now seemed so natural and organic to most DDE employees that they could n't imagine working somewhere without that . The surprising success of the Mailgirls program at DDE had caught the eye of corporate America and resistance to a concept that had once seemed so outlandish was slowly fading . <p> The gap between the " norms " and the mailgirls had also never been greater . As Barbara had predicted , both groups had , for the most part , internalized their roles as masters and slaves . While inappropriate touching and sexual contact was still strictly forbidden - and there had been incidents that had cost employees their jobs - there was a growing debate at the highest levels @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ away with . Could mailgirls be forced to assume even more sexually provocative positions than they already were ? Could a mailgirl be requested to " voluntarily " masturbate in front of employees since no contact would take place ? Could " light " corporal punishment and bondage ( spankings , paddlings , handcuffs , leashes ) as punishment for disobedience and excessive demerits be written into future contracts ? Just how far could they go in debasing and humiliating mailgirls and get away with it ? Company lawyers had already begun researching these and other thorny legal questions . <p> There was also the question of what to do about mailgirls when they were away from work . While they were on the job virtually every step they took and everything they did - from bathroom breaks to the amount and type of food they were allowed to eat - was carefully monitored and controlled by the company . Away from work , however , mailgirls reverted back to being " real people . " They could dress as they pleased , eat and drink too much , say @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ anyone else . More and more executives at the top of DDE were finding this " problematic " since it undermined the company 's emerging caste system with mailgirls at the bottom as its servant class . <p> Although fraternization between norms and mailgirls away from work was strictly prohibited , in reality it was something that was nearly impossible for DDE to enforce . Most of the company 's youthful workforce lived in Wildwood near the DDE complex so it was inevitable that norms and mailgirls would run into each other out there in the real world and interact and converse as normal human beings . There was a growing thought in upper management that being a mailgirl needed to be a 24/7 commitment . They obviously could n't be forced to work all day every day but their " dress code " and manner of addressing their superiors ( everyone else ) must be strictly enforced at all times . In other words , mailgirls must be required to remain naked and subservient even when off duty . Barbara , of course , fully encouraged this idea . @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ how the logistics of this would work , the consensus was moving toward making that happen . <p> At 12:15 my MMU vibrated alerting me to my thirty minute lunch break . I took a quick shower to wash the morning sweat and grime off and then went to the employee cafeteria to eat my meal alone on the floor surrounded by norms . This was something that Barbara had ordered long ago because of my disobedience and I wondered if it would continue after becoming her full time pet . I actually hoped that it would if for no other reason than to have some time alone away from her . <p> After lunch I went back to work and was just finishing my third delivery of the afternoon when my MMU buzzed with another summons . @@2907508 <p> Jon Killen/TimesDaily file An unidentified man walks with Judy Wicker during her 1982 trial for the murder-for-hire killing of her husband , Troy Wicker , of Muscle Shoals . Tommy Arthur was convicted of capital murder for the killing and is on death row at Holman Prison . Judy Wicker now shuns any photos or publicity about the killing . <p> More than 27 years after the shooting death of her husband , Judy Wicker is on a crusade to keep the man convicted of killing him in prison . <p> " I will die before I see him walk out of prison , " she said of Thomas Douglas Arthur 's latest attempts to be released from death row . <p> Meanwhile , Arthur 's daughter , Sherrie Stone , is on a crusade of her own aimed at seeing the conviction overturned . <p> These opposing efforts met face to face when Wicker and Stone visited each other in an emotional discussion of the case . <p> Stone , who lives in Florida , maintains a Web page , **28;699;TOOLONG , that seeks support for helping win @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ sentenced to death for a crime he did not commit . <p> Arthur , 66 , has been convicted three times in the Feb. 1 , 1982 , shooting death of Troy Wicker Jr . in Muscle Shoals . He has twice come within hours of being executed but it was postponed each time . <p> Judy Wicker has testified against Arthur in two trials , saying she agreed to pay him $10,000 and had sex with him in exchange for killing her husband . <p> Arthur has maintained his innocence . <p> Judy Wicker was released in 1992 after serving 10 years of a life sentence . Arthur remains in Holman Correctional Facility in Atmore , fighting for his life through the appeals process . <p> Earlier this month , Jefferson County Circuit Court Judge Teresa Pulliam ordered the Alabama Department of Forensic Sciences to test evidence collected after Troy Wicker 's death to determine if Gilbert 's or Arthur 's DNA is present . Pulliam said the testing would help her determine the credibility of Gilbert 's claims . <p> The judge has told the state to have @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ I do n't know him <p> Wicker said Gilbert 's DNA will not be found . <p> " I do n't know the Gilbert man , " she said during an interview with the TimesDaily last week . " I have never heard of him . I had never seen him until ( Assistant Attorney General ) Clay Crenshaw showed me a picture after Gilbert made his confession . " <p> In the confession , Gilbert , 43 , said he had an affair with Wicker when he was 17 years old . She asked him to kill her husband , he contends . <p> A witness at the hearing in Jefferson County court earlier this month said he passed notes between Arthur and Gilbert when all three were in Holman prison . <p> Wicker said she was shocked to learn of Gilbert 's confession , which came three days before Arthur was scheduled to be executed . Then she got angry . <p> " This is just Tommy 's way of bringing me back into this , " she said . " I wish he would just leave me @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ he has brought me back into it , I am going to do everything in my power to see that Tommy dies in prison . <p> " He 's laughing at the prosecutors , he 's laughing at the judges , he 's laughing at me and he 's wasting the taxpayers ' money . " <p> Living in fear <p> Wicker said she lives in fear that if Arthur is released from prison , she or her family will be killed . <p> " He is a dangerous man , " she said . " A lot of people might say they are going to kill you but not mean it . If Tommy Arthur says he is going to kill someone , he means it . He told me before either of us were arrested that if I ever told anyone what he did , he would kill me . He even threatened to blow up the police station with me inside if he ever heard I had gone to the police to tell them what he did . " <p> She refuses to say where she lives @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ name . She continues to introduce herself as Judy Wicker at Arthur 's court proceedings . " Tommy does n't ask you to do something ; he demands it . When he gets something in his @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ Wicker said she lived with the shame and humiliation of playing a role in her husband 's homicide for years , only talking about it with her family and closest friends . " I 'm tired , I 've battled this for 27 years and the truth is the truth . I believe in our justice system and I believe in the end , Tommy will die in prison . " <p> Wicker did not testify against Arthur in his first trial because her conviction was being appealed . She testified in Arthur 's second trial in 1987 and at his third trial in 1991 . His first trial was overturned because jurors were allowed to hear details of Arthur 's 1977 murder conviction . His second trial was overturned in part because Arthur was not allowed to have an attorney present when he was initially questioned about the killing . <p> Wicker said if the judge orders yet another new trial for Arthur , she is willing to testify again . <p> Arthur contends Wicker agreed to provide @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ <p> Wicker said she asked to be moved from Tutwiler Prison after agreeing to help the prosecution because she feared for her safety . <p> " I was scared . The exact facility has been kept secret . @@2907526 <p> I have been weaving seats for over 30 years as part of the services we offer in our furniture restoration service that is over 40 years young . Chances are you have woven more chairs in 14 years than I have in 30 . I agree on some and disagree on other points about staining and sealing . <p> I agree that staining will not weaken cane . I also burn off " hair " if there is a lot of them . I do this with a propane torch and when the cane is still wet . This minimizes the chance of a woops . <p> I seal every type of seat I weave cane , paper rush , natural rush , hickory and oak splint and also danish cord , sea grass and wicker . Sealing any natural and the paper weaving materials does not cause it to dry out faster . On the contrary it extends its useful life . If you have used Minwax stains to color woven seats you have been sealing them with that product . It contains oils and resins the polymerize @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ recommend using shellac if you are trying to reproduce a historic or period finish . You can achieve the same look with modern finishing materials that will last longer and give better protection . If you want a more natural look and still want to seal the fiber use a water based finish as opposed to an oil based finish . When the water based finish is dry the natural color will look the same . Any oil based finish use to seal the fibers will darken it . You can use a water based flat ( low sheen ) poly acrylic on paper rush , sea grass , natural rush and danish cord . When dry it does a very good job of sealing the fibers and protection the seat from spill and stains from foods as well as extending its useful life . <p> I have been doing this for over 14 years and have stained almost everything I have worked on . The only thing you should seal is fibre rush and you should use shellac . If caning is sealed it dries out ... more <p> @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ my bee club . @@2907533 <h> 2007-06-19 <p> Subject : Anita Bogan , a 106-year-old woman who offers another of life 's greatest lessons . <p> Welcome to Kazan Today : Anita Bogan , a 106-year-old woman who offers another of life 's greatest lessons . <h> Entertaining and compelling real-life stories with valuablelessons on how to succeed in business and in life . The author is successful business , real estate , and media entrepreneur Dick Kazan . <h> Published on June 19 , 2007 <p> Today : A 106-year-old woman offers us two of lifes greatest lessons . <p> This woman is Anita Bogan , a black woman who overcame bigotry , the Great Depression and numerous other obstacles to live a full and fun-filled life right to the day she passed away at the age of 106 this year . <p> A long-time South Central Los Angeles resident , Anita built a successful transportation business , and she also built a very successful flower shop business . <p> And there were two things that were key to her happiness and to her success . One of these is the first of our @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ obstacles she faced , she calmly and promptly dealt with them rather than to let them stress her . <p> For example , Anita was married five times before she married the love of her life , Cecil " Boggie " Bogan . Anita and Boggie were happily married for nearly 30-years , until he became i 'll and died . <p> But in a prior marriage , Anita found out her husband had been secretly seeing a neighbor on the side . When he returned home from a romantic rendezvous , rather than getting upset and making a scene , Anita had placed his belongings neatly on their front porch . And she calmly said to him , " This marriage is over , " and she meant it , as a divorce quickly followed . <p> Years later when Pat Martin , one of her two adoptive daughters came to her terribly upset with a problem she was having with her neighbor , Anita listened . " We were arguing about construction of a fence , " Pat said . And who would pay for it . <p> " @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ them with kindness . Ask how high they want it , how much will it cost and then just pay half . " And that 's what Pat did . And just like that , there was peace with the neighbor and the amount of money involved was soon forgotten . <p> For everyone moved on with their lives with no further concern for what had been a very stressful issue . By contrast how many of us get upset and internalize what are actually minor issues if only we were objective enough to see them that way . <p> " She did n't  get stressed , " Pat said . " That 's how she lived for so long . " <p> Speaking of not getting stressed , when Anita turned 72 in 1972 she calmly made a life-changing decision . She decided to retire and move to the warm dry climate of California City , a community of 8,400 people in the Mojave Desert . <p> But Anita did n't  retire . When she arrived she saw the city had no flower shop . Flowers were a life-long passion of @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ was a business she would joyfully run for the next 16-years , finally retiring from it at the age of 88 . <p> Also in the 1970s , Anita tackled another project . The city had no senior citizen housing and she decided to do something about it . Skeptics said she was wasting her time , it would never happen . <p> Anita helped to organize a housing authority to solicit government funds and she began speaking with property owners to sell some of their property cheaply for a good cause . At first when nothing seemed to come of her efforts , the skeptics laughed them off . <p> But 15-years of Anitas good natured perseverance paid off big in 1993 with the grand-opening of Desert Jade Villas , a beautiful non-profit 43-unit seniors complex . Anita was 93 at that time but of course she went to work on the expansion of Desert Jade Villas . Today it contains 96 units . <p> As if her schedule was n't busy enough with her flower shop and her Desert Jade Villas project , in her 70s Anita took up @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ she passionately played golf until she was 102 . <p> In addition to golf , Anita went to exercise class at the senior citizen complex until she was " 105 at least , " said her cousin Dee Dee Brown in amazement . " Two or three times a week . " <p> And yet that was still not enough for Anita . By her front door , she always kept a suit case packed and a bag of coins nearby . For Anita loved to play the slot machines . And if anyone was on their way to Las Vegas or to Stateline , she was always ready to go on short notice . <p> In her favorite casino , on her birthday each year they would attach a balloon to her favorite slot machine and host a party for her . Soon she was inundated with people who knew and loved her and she would hold court , dispensing " Dr. Phil " type advice . <p> And this was the other key to her happiness and her success and it offers us the second of lifes greatest @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ life . By contrast , how many times have you or I missed out on a good time because we were too busy . <p> And speaking of " Dr. Phil " type advice , Anita thoroughly enjoyed dispensing her wisdom . " If you were her friend , she would give you lifes lessons , " said Dorothy Lawson , Anitas close friend the last several years of her life . <p> " Shed say , Never say anything to someone you would n't want them to say to you. Shed say , Think before you speak . After you 've said it , you cant take it back. She never understood why people have to be enemies . " <p> For Anita always looked for the best in people and offered them kind words of support . How many of us take the time or have the interest to do that . <p> But for each person , in life the end must come . This year , at the age of 106 , time finally caught up with Anita . She was surrounded by loved ones at her hospital @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ clot . <p> To a caller planning to come the next day , she said with a smile , " You better come today . I wont be here tomorrow . " And she was right , as her life came to a gentle end . <p> Throughout her life , Anita overcame all her problems including bigotry , the Great Depression and the loss of Boggie because she kept a positive attitude , committed herself to have fun , released her stress and she refused to feel sorry for herself . There was no " poor me " in her vocabulary . <p> Instead she had fun , enthusiastically helped others and made the world a little better place . <p> Success Tip of the Week : As Anita Bogan would do , do something fun this week , something you have been meaning to do for ages . <p> Editor 's Note : Thank you to Los Angeles Times staff writer Jocelyn Stewart for her assistance in telling this story . The obit she wrote , " Anita Bogan , 106 : proved old age is no obstacle @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ cousins Dee Dee Brown and Cleo Pierce , adoptive daughter Pat Martin and Anitas close friend , Dorothy Lawson for their help for I never could have told her story without them . <p> In the next KazanToday : A working class man , who founded a famous animal sanctuary to rescue abandoned or tortured animals that desperately needed a home . <p> Many of these short , inspirational success stories are about people from all walks of life who overcame seemingly insurmountable obstacles to achieve remarkable results . These stories contain practical advice and a recipe for success for each of these renowned individuals . Some of their stories may help you to avoid some of the costly and time consuming mistakes that many of us make in life and at work . Learn from some of history 's greatest winners on how to become a winner yourself , no matter what the obstacle , and no matter how daunting the task before you may seem . Good luck !

@@2907551 <p> One of the reasons you would adopt a remeasurment contract is if there are large amounts of work where the accuracy of quantities is affected by actual site conditions , which can only be determined during contract administration stage ( i.e. Civil Engineering Project ) . You may also want to share the risk on uncertain quantities between Employer and Contractor ( i.e. less cost for risk built in to the tender return ) <p> Pre-Contract : BQ preparation for remeasurement Contracts is more or less the same as preparing BQ for lump sum Contracts . Using HK Govenment approach for Civil Engineering Projects as an example , the BQ is prepared using the SMM for Civil Engineering Works . Same as if preparing BQ for lump sum Contracts for Civil Engineering Projects . The is minimal speed advantage . @@2907554 <p> Does one of these statements sound familiar to you ? You played 10 sets in your favorite lottery and once again the same thing happened : You were not even close to a hit or you just missed a hit by one number . <p> How can we change that ? It is actually easier than you think . We need a few things to get started : <p> A decent statistical background of the lottery we play <p> A decent number of current drawings to work with <p> A decent strategy based on 1 ) and 2 ) to pick the numbers <p> In this article these three topics will be described based on recent examples . This article is the base of 4 new tools developed that currently help many users to win the lottery more often then ever before . <p> Statistical background <p> Probably the most difficult part of the challenge is to get the accurate background required to play a lottery . You will find chances on the Lottery that you are playing on the web site of your state or country but what @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ how to adopt the knowledge to what numbers to pick is another story as well . <p> Example : Canada 6/49 with Bonus Number <p> First statistical question : When you pick numbers you play , should you pick a number that just came out in the last drawing ? <p> From the statistical point of view : Definitely ! In a 6/49 lottery with bonus number game the chances that none of the previously drawn numbers will reappear is only 31% ! In 69% of cases at least one of the numbers that just came out will reappear . This is of course different in other lotteries ! <p> Here the complete list of chances ( including bonus number ) : <p> Chances for no number to repeat : 31.5% <p> Chances for 1 number to repeat : 43% <p> Chances for 2 number to repeat : 20% <p> Chances for 3 number to repeat : 4.5% <p> Chances for 4 number to repeat : 0.5% <p> Chances for 5 and more number to repeat : almost 0% <p> Second statistical question : How many 3 number wins can @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ . Unfortunately ! In a 6/49 lottery you can expect to hit 3 correct numbers only once in every 56 picks ! To get 4 correct numbers you need about 1000 picks . <p> There is other statistical information to look at that should be looked at . For example most of the drawings contain between 2 to 4 even numbers and most of the drawings contain between 2 to 4 low numbers . <p> Drawings to work with <p> How many drawings should be look at when we are trying to find the right numbers to play with ? <p> We use a rule of thumb that worked very well in past which is <p> Half of the number field divided by the numbers in a set . As an example 6/49 : <p> 49 divided by 6 which is about 8 <p> Half of 8 is 4 . <p> 4 previous sets should be looked at . That 's what we going to do : <p> 8 <p> 10 <p> 15 <p> 16 <p> 31 <p> 46 <p> B25 <p> 15 <p> 21 <p> 31 <p> 36 <p> @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ 32 <p> 33 <p> 34 <p> 35 <p> B7 <p> 5 <p> 7 <p> 18 <p> 30 <p> 37 <p> 46 <p> B19 <p> What do these previous drawings tell us ? For example 15 , 31 and 46 of the latest drawing were drawn twice as real numbers . Those might be good candidates to eliminate completely . <p> An unusual selection appeared three drawings ago . 32 , 33 , 34 , 35 in one line . Only one low number 1 . A good suggestion would be to eliminate this row from the evaluation . <p> Number Picking Strategy <p> What can the player learn from the statistical and drawing information ? <p> Now that we know that in 69% of the cases at least one number repeats from the last drawing tells us : Every set you play should at least include a number that just came out ! <p> Even/odds/highs/lows : Play only numbers with between 2 and 4 even numbers and between 2 and 4 high numbers . <p> The previous drawings show us to eliminate certain numbers , in this case 15 , @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ often recently ! <p> How do these selections work ? <p> To show you an example of a tool that takes care of these selections for you here the selection of only 15 potential numbers of the Canadian 6/49 drawings picked the following choices : <p> No . <p> Set <p> hits <p> 1 <p> 02-03-07-25-42-48 <p> 3 <p> 2 <p> 06-07-10-39-42-43 <p> 1 <p> 3 <p> 06-07-10-29-42-43 <p> 1 <p> 4 <p> 07-10-26-27-29-36 <p> 1B <p> 5 <p> 04-07-08-17-26-33 <p> 1 <p> 6 <p> 04-07-22-24-25-45 <p> 2 <p> 7 <p> 07-08-11-33-42-45 <p> 1 <p> 8 <p> 07-08-20-27-38-44 <p> 1B <p> 9 <p> 01-07-10-12-29-42 <p> 1 <p> 10 <p> 03-07-25-28-40-42 <p> 3 <p> 11 <p> 03-07-25-28-42-48 <p> 4 <p> 12 <p> 02-07-20-25-42-48 <p> 3 <p> 13 <p> 07-08-09-20-27-44 <p> 2B <p> 14 <p> 07-16-27-34-38-43 <p> 1B <p> 15 <p> 07-12-16-34-38-43 <p> 1 <p> The B stands for bonus number .
