@@2907581 <p> Well , I received my two Yamaha DBR10 and today I gave them a workout to see how they perform . In a simple nutshell , I am VERY pleased with these speakers . What is NOT to like ? Well , a handle on the side would be very appreciated , but other than that , these speakers get the Tony seal of approval . <p> First , let me tell you that I was told correctly , these things have an amazing amount of low frequency . Perhaps " too much low " if you do not manage the speaker 's output just a little . <p> My anticipated " normal " venue would be one of several small clubs or pub/restaurants locally . So I took the speakers to the City of Stillwater Community Center ( Stillwater , Oklahoma , USA ) to do a sample set up . The Houston Theater is a 700 seat venue , a former high school auditorium . But I limited my test area to the actual stage . I elected to leave the main curtain open and took advantage @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ " on three sides . <p> I set the speakers on a standard 8 foot long folding table facing " across the stage " to the side curtains approximately 40 feet away from the mixer . Source was an iPhone playing mp3 . The mixer was a Mackie ProFX12 . The channel strip was set with input gain at " 12 o'clock " on the rotary dial . All channel EQ was set at 12 o'clock on the rotary dials . The Pan/Balance was also set at 12 o'clock . The channel fader was set at Unity and the Master fader was also set at Unity . <p> The two evaluators were my friend and co-worker Shawn and myself . I trust Shawn 's ears far more than I trust my own ears . He always gets positive comments from clients and musicians on the quality of his mix . I am living proof that nearly any semi-deaf old man can afford to buy quality sound gear . <p> The Yamaha DBR10 is a simple speaker to set up and operate . There is a two channel mixer on the @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ a photo of the back of the powered speaker and enlarge it so you can see the control panel yourself . There is no guessing which scale on the rotary knob is correct for your application . Channel 1 on the back has a combination XLR and 1/4 input , a " Level " and a swtich for " Mic/Line " . Channel 2 has a combination XLR and 1/4 input jack along with a color coded pair of RCA inputs and a " Level " rotary knob . We did not use the " Output " section for this exercise since each speaker received signal from the mixer . <p> There is also a " DSP " section on the back of the speaker . The D-Contour control is a 3 position switch that can be set for " FOH/Main " , center " OFF " , and " Monitor " . The " HPF " section has a 3 position switch that can be set for a frequency cut at " 120 " or at " 100 " or " OFF " . <p> Worthy of further discussion @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ that attempts to show the user the results of selecting either " FOH/Main " or " Monitor " by showing a schematic of which frequencies would be cut or boosted . Main/FOH boosts the lows and leaves the mids " flat " and slightly boosts the highs according to the graphic . Monitor cuts the lows , leaves the mids flat , and boosts the highs . <p> When set with the D-Contour on FOH/Main and the HPF set OFF , the DBR10 had a fairly strong low frequency content that tended to overwhelm the signal from the horn . <p> Rather than going thru the exercise we did , I will simply tell you that we determined that there was a slight difference between " D-Contour Monitor and HPF Off " and/or the sound from " D-Contour FOH/Main " and HPF Cut at 100 Hz " . But we both agreed that the vocals were slightly more clear with the " D-Contour FOH/Main and HPF Cut at 100 Hz . " <p> We both agreed that the speakers were very good for my applications of monitors or stand alone @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ to order two more so I can do a small , simple " two on tripod stands , two laying flat as monitor " PA system . And all four can then be used with my " medium sized PA " ( two JBL PRX612M self powered mains and two JBL MPro-418S passive subs ( powered by a stereo QSC PLX3402 ) . <p> One brief story : Shawn told me that he walked by while I was setting the system up and blowing out some cobwebs and he said it sounded like a full performance inside the theater ... meaning full range , plenty of volume . Not bad for a pair of 325 Watt Continuous/RMS 10 inch woofers with 1.4 inch horn drivers that weigh in at 23.2 pounds . <p> 23lbs for a powered cab ... wow . I have a QSC K8 that I purchased a couple of years ago and have used it with a wireless lav mic for wedding ceremonies .. A funny thing though .... I fired it up before ... more <p> I use ONE DBR10 when I play in nursing homes @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ drum machine , and sing . In the full range mode the little box makes some really tight and punchy bass ( kick ... more <p> Uhhh , the DBR10 has only been on the market for about 4 or 5 months , I think . They sold out the first shipment at Musician 's Friend . ----------- I can not cut and paste from the original email so even ... more <p> I made a Freudian slip above . I typed the following : I need to emphasize that the DBR8 has a LOT of low end production . CORRECTION , I should have written : I need to emphasize that the DBR10 has a LOT ... more

@@2907598 <p> Sure , part of it consisted of crazed loonies attempting to make lead into gold . But there was much more to it than that . <p> Q : How did it start ? A : Wishful thinking , mostly , plus the results of early metallurgy . <p> Q : Why did the Alchemists believe that they could convert base metals ( lead , mercury , tin , etc ) into gold ? A : Because , many metals , when heated , oxidize and develop a yellowish tint , which they believed was the first sign of being converted into gold . <p> Q : What was the underlying theory of matter to which the alchemists subscribed ? A : They thought that all metals were made of the same fundamental " elements " which could be re-arranged to make gold ? The useful definition of chemical elements had to wait until Lavoisier . <p> Q : Was the sole purpose of alchemists converting base metals into gold ? A : No . They were equally interested in development of medicines . <p> Q : Was all @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ that there was no sharp distinction between Metallurgy and Alchemy . There were those Alchemists who discovered how to recover gold from such things as natural alloys ( with silver &amp; copper ) and mine wastes . That gold was real . They also discovered how to extract gold from its compounds calaverite and krennerite ( AuTe2 ) , petzite ( Ag3AuTe2 ) , and sylvanite ( AgAuTe4 ) . ( I bet that you thought that gold does not form natural compounds . Wrong . It is found combined with tellurium to form the minerals listed previously . ) In addition , gold is frequently found in small concentrations with silver and copper . The concentrations are so low that the gold can not be detected by casual inspection , but it can be separated out by various means discovered by the alchemists . Gold was and is so valuable that it paid then , and it still pays , to extract it from very dilute natural alloys and mining wastes . <p> Q : Which alchemists made significant contributions to chemistry ? A : Paracelsus , Jabir , @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ . The latter introduced quantitative methods using precise weighing and measuring and discovered the conservation of mass in chemical reactions , one of the cornerstones of modern science . <p> I would add " a driving Curiosity " to your first question about how did Alchemy start .... I was one of those tomboys who preferred chemistry kits and microscopes to dolls . My driving curiosity caused ... more <p> And that 's what I love about the computer age . If you are curious about something ... you can look up just about anything on the computer , at your fingertips . Of course , there is nothing like hands on ... more 
@@2907599 <p> Hon. Patrick Lindsay was born on 14 November 1928.1 He was the son of Sir David Alexander Robert Lindsay , 28th Earl of Crawford and Mary Katherine Cavendish.1 He married Lady Amabel Mary Maud Yorke , daughter of Philip Grantham Yorke , 9th Earl of Hardwicke and Sarah Katharine Lindley , on 16 December 1955.1 He died in 1986.1 Hon. Patrick Lindsay was educated at Eton College , Eton , Berkshire , England.1 He gained the rank of 2nd Lieutenant in the service of the Scots Guards.1 He was educated at Magdalen College , Oxford University , Oxford , Oxfordshire , England.1 He was a director of Christies , and head of the Old Masters department.1 Children of Hon. Patrick Lindsay and Lady Amabel Mary Maud Yorke Laura Mary Lindsay b. 10 Oct 1956 Alexander Ludovic Lindsay+ b. 16 Sep 1957 James Richard Lindsay+ b. 4 May 1961 Valentine Lindsay+ b. 6 Oct 1962 <p> Patrick was an enthusiast for all things mechanical as well as being a trained fine art authority and connoisseur . @@2907616 <p> The father of an 11-year-old boy murdered by a juvenile killer in Kobe in 1997 has issued a statement calling for rules banning perpetrators of serious crimes from publishing books related to their heinous activities . <p> Mamoru Hase , 60 , whose son , Jun , was strangled and whose decapitated head was placed outside a school gate in the notorious murder case , released the statement to the media Tuesday , the 19th anniversary of his sons death . <p> Hase expressed disgust over last years publication of a memoir by the perpetrator , who is now 33 . <p> The memoir " was published with no notice to victims or bereaved families , " Hase said in his statement . <p> " The book has aggravated the victims feelings and is an aggression by itself . " <p> Hase went on to say the issue is not about freedom of expression , but there should be regulations , if not an outright ban , barring criminals who try to publish books about their own crimes . <p> In the memoir , the killer , using the @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ " a beauty . " <p> " Let me confess something : I thought the sight was a beauty , " he wrote in the book published in June 2015 , recalling how he felt when he placed the boys severed head at the school gate . <p> " I felt like I was born just to see the ethereal beauty of what was in front of my eyes . I thought I could die . " <p> Hase said he has rejected any correspondence from Sakakibara since the book was published , saying he does n't  " want to have anything to do with him . " <p> " I vividly remember what happened on that day 19 years ago , like it was yesterday , " Hase wrote . " My love for my son has n't  changed . " <p> The stabbing of 20-year-old female idol Mayu Tomita has sparked a discussion over the effectiveness of the anti-stalking law , which some experts say should include a clear statement on preventing the kind of online stalking the latest victim was facing . <p> The current anti-stalking law @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ networking websites " as it is not worded to include harassment via social media , Yohei Shimizu , a Tokyo lawyer well-versed in online defamation cases , said Monday . <p> According to media reports , 27-year-old Tomohiro Iwazaki , who was arrested Saturday for stabbing Tomita nearly two dozen times in the neck and chest , had apparently repeatedly sent messages to her Twitter account . <p> Police on Monday turned Iwazaki over to prosecutors on suspicion of attempted murder and violating the Firearm and Sword Control Law . <p> Tomita , who remains hospitalized in critical condition , had earlier visited a police station near her home in the Tokyo suburb of Musashino and asked them to stop Iwazaki harassing her online via social networking sites . <p> Although Tomita gave Iwazakis name and address to the police on May 9 , they did not contact him , saying it was necessary to confirm that the messages were actually written by him . <p> The police also failed to hand over the case to a unit tasked with investigating stalking on the grounds that the Twitter messages did @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ . <p> Tomitas mother meanwhile had telephoned the Kyoto Prefectural Police on May 4 to ask them to do something about the online stalking , as Iwazaki apparently lived in Kyoto , but they told her to contact the police in Tokyo , where her daughter lives . <p> Attorney Shimizu said the police should have at least contacted Iwazaki regardless of whether they could confirm that the anonymous Twitter account belonged to him . <p> " Even if the person had said he had nothing to do with the Twitter account , a visit by the police could have served as a warning " and would likely have dissuaded Iwazaki from carrying out the attack , Shimizu said . <p> According to Kyodo , the Twitter account that is believed to belong to Iwazaki was created in January and was used to send friendly messages to Tomita at first . <p> But it started to show aggressiveness toward her in February , when it demanded she have a " sincere relationship " with him . <p> In one tweet , the writer said he was " furious , " @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ to kill someone just because one is turned down . " <p> The same Twitter account holder said he sent a watch to Tomita sometime between January and February . It was apparently returned to the sender in April . <p> Iwazaki told the police he was furious that Tomita had returned the gift to him , according to Kyodo News . <p> The current anti-stalking law , revised in 2013 , does not ban sending messages repeatedly on social media if it can be seen by other people , although it bans persistent one-on-one unwanted contact via telephone , fax and email , Shimizu said . <p> He said the law can also cover messages on social media if they are particularly abusive . <p> But the police this time did not take the Twitter messages to be particularly threatening . <p> " Stalking on social media can not be directly combatted with the current anti-stalking law . <p> I believe it needs an explicit clause to regulate such harassment , " he said . " Otherwise , the law can not function properly . " <p> Eiichi Mori @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ the anti-stalking law as it currently stands has failed to achieve its intent to prevent incidents before they happen . <p> " Laws need to be revised constantly so as to catch up with advancing technology , " Mori said . " It may be too late to revise the law after what happened , but it is still better than repeating the same tragedy . " <p> Japan sends two more inmates to the gallowsBY SHUSUKE MURAISTAFF WRITERMAR 25 , 2016 <p> Two death row inmates were hanged Friday morning , according to the Justice Ministry , bringing to 16 the number of executions carried out under Prime Minister Shinzo Abes administration since taking power in 2012 . <p> The two prisoners were Yasutoshi Kamata , 75 , and Junko Yoshida , 56 . Yoshida is only the fifth woman to face the gallows according to ministry records that date back to 1950 , and the first hanged since 2012 . <p> Kamata was sentenced to death in 2005 for killing five females in Osaka between 1985 and 1994 , including a 9-year-old girl . Kamata abducted the girl @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ . He was also found guilty of kidnapping , having demanded a ransom from the girls father . <p> Yoshida , a former nurse from Fukuoka Prefecture , was convicted for conspiring with three other hospital employees in 1998 and 1999 to kill two of their husbands in schemes to pocket 67 million yen in insurance money . She was found guilty for being the mastermind behind the killings and sentenced to death in 2010 . <p> Justice Minister Mitsuhide Iwaki , who signed the order for the executions , emphasized they were only carried out after " careful examination , " and it was determined there was no valid reason for retrials . <p> " These two atrocious cases claimed the precious lives of the victims for extremely selfish reasons . I feel sorrow for those who were murdered and their families , " he told a news conference following the hangings . <p> The last time Japan hanged a death row inmate was in December . <p> The executions Friday were the second time capital punishment has been carried out since Iwaki took over the ministry five months @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ now been hanged under the current Abe administration . <p> Meanwhile , Amnesty International Japan , a human rights group opposed to capital punishment , criticized the latest executions , saying a string of capital punishment cases is evidence the administration is " disregarding lives . " <p> " From the international perspective , by keeping this atrocious , inhumane punishment it seems that . . . ( Japan ) disregards human rights by going against the ( international ) trend to abolish the death penalty , " the group said in a statement . " We extremely regret the executions this time , especially when the country is about to play a role in leading the international society as the host country of the G-7 Ise-Shima summit . " <p> There are now 124 inmates on death row in Japan after Fridays hangings , of which 89 are seeking retrials and 22 are seeking amnesties , according to the Justice Ministry . <p> " It 's a Push Bad Here ; Perishing the Whole of the Druid Peoples . " Those are two Tele receives from early this day @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ the whole of the Druid peoples . " Stoking relentless ... more <p> UFOs Photographed over Taroko National Park UFO over Taiwan Published : 8:46 PM 5/19/2016 appears to be two objects surrounded by lights ... @@2907617 <p> Recently several historians suggested that I repost the article I wrote back in 2007 about the Lang Spraggins collection of phony western memorabilia . Casey Tefertiller posted it then , but it is no longer available online . <p> Lang Spraggins , now deceased , was a disreputable gun collector in New Mexico . His so-called " lifetime collection " was auctioned that year , 2007 . It was the largest assemblage of fake western items ever put on the market . Several dealers and historians , including me , reported this auction to the FBI at the time , but the FBI did nothing to stop it and did not even investigate . The below article is an edited version of my letter to the FBI office in Denver , Colorado , where the auction took place . These fake Lang Spraggins artifacts and phony photos keep resurfacing , which is why I was asked to repost the below information . <p> Auction of Fake Western Memorabilia <p> by John Boessenecker <p> In addition to authoring books and articles about lawlessness in the Old West , I have @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ and a collector of Wells Fargo and historical guns and western memorabilia for 20 years . Over the years , as the prices of historically connected western artifacts have skyrocketed , fakes have become more and more of a problem . A large collection of such phony items , from the collection of one Lang Spraggins , an elderly gun dealer from Albuquerque , was recently put on the block by Engel Auction Co. in Denver . <p> In recent years it has become increasingly common for guns to appear on the market with the names of such well known western lawmen like Wyatt Earp , Dallas Stoudenmire , and Bat Masterson , engraved on them . Normally such guns , if authentic , would either be well known to the collecting fraternity , having been in various collections for forty years or more , or they would be accompanied by probate or other records showing their provenance and authenticity . However , such fake guns are never accompanied by any documentation at all . Now , more than just guns have been appearing , and the items in this @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ . <p> Many of the items discussed below were created by the same person , as they bear similar hallmarks of crude , naive , construction , plus an informed but ultimately shallow knowledge of our outlaw-lawman history . The fake items all have the names of more or less famous westerners conveniently engraved or marked on them . <p> Any item owned by a " first tier " western personage , such as George A. Custer , Wild Bill Hickok , or Buffalo Bill Cody , would sell for a large amount of money . The buyer would be a wealthy person , who if cheated , would have the money to hire lawyers and make a great deal of trouble for the persons who made and/or sold it . Therefore the person or persons engaged in making this new wave of fake items has turned to the " second tier " western characters . They are not as well known , therefore fetching lower prices , and making the fraud less likely to be attacked by either a private civil lawsuit or by a criminal prosecution . So @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ Brewer , C.E. Hoxie , Bill Tilghman , C.S. Fly , Isom Dart , Alexander McSween , etc. , appeared in this auction . <p> This so-called Lang Spraggins auction was the largest assemblage of phony items ever seen in one place . Long before the day of the auction , it was the topic of considerable talk among western collectors and dealers . The auctioneer was repeatedly warned that many of the items in the auction were fake , but he ignored the warnings and went ahead with the auction anyway . The result is that many unsuspecting bidders bought fake items . <p> There were numerous inscribed law enforcement badges in the sale . All the inscribed badges were outrageous fakes . All of them were obviously engraved by the same hand . None of them looked remotely like an authentic 19th century badge . The construction of these badges , and the style of engraving , was a modern fantasy of what a real badge might have looked like . The same is true of numerous presentation watches that were offered . These are genuine old pocket @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ them . Many of these pocket watches were engraved with presentations on the outside of the case . That is absurd , as any watch collector will tell you . Presentations were inscribed on the inside of the dust cover . <p> The style of engraving on the offered badges and watches has only surfaced in the past few years . I have seen similar examples for sale at gun shows , always inscribed with the name of a noted lawman or western figure . The style of engraving is always the same . No knowledgeable collector would ever touch the stuff . <p> Now to specifics . In the auction was offered Doc Holliday 's dental chair ( sold for $13,000 ) , his syringe and kit ( $5,000 ) , his collapsible drinking cup ( $12,000 ) , medical bag ( $17,000 ) , and a leather case ( $16,000 ) . Given that there are one or two other Doc Holliday dental chairs floating around , one wonders how an itinerant frontier dentist could have had so many chairs . Unlike most of the other items in @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ provenance . Unfortunately , the letters of provenance were obvious falsehoods . Also sold was a Doc Holliday presentation watch , allegedly presented to Joshua Webb , which fetched more than $40,000 . If you believe this stuff was real , I have some beach front property in Arizona . . . . <p> Another laughable item was a purported Billy the Kid wanted poster ( sold for $14,000 ) . These are offered from time to time on ebay and are all fakes/fantasy items . A James-Younger wanted poster was also a well known fake , frequently offered on ebay . Neither of these posters looks remotely like a 19th century wanted poster . The authentic wanted posters for Jesse James are only a few , are well documented , and this was not one of them . <p> A tintype photograph , worth about $10 , was identified as Billy the Kid and a gullible bidder paid $32,500 for it . Collectors call such photographs " look alikes " and no one with any common sense will buy them . This photo was a " look alike " @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ . <p> A cap and ball Colt revolver was offered , allegedly presented to Wells Fargo Detective James B. Hume for capturing Charles E. Boles ( Black Bart ) . It was also a fake for the simple reason that Hume did not arrest Black Bart . This is an old myth and I went to great lengths to point that out in my book , Lawman : The Life and Times of Harry N. Morse ( University of Oklahoma Press , 1998 ) . Since Hume never arrested Black Bart , why would Wells Fargo give him a gun for so doing ? Also , Black Bart was arrested by Morse in 1883 . Why would Wells Fargo present an obsolete percussion Colt in 1883 ? <p> A blue enamel shield badge bearing the identification of William T. Coleman , San Francisco Vigilance Committee , illustrates how the faker does his work . This was a crude attempt to copy the badge of San Francisco Police Detective Henry Ellis , which was illustrated in Brian and Brad Witherell 's book , California 's Best , at p. 24 . @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ this from the photo in the book , by copying the style of the badge , and putting Coleman 's name in place of Ellis 's . The same faker has tried to copy similar items from other western antique books by copying the style but putting a different person 's name on the item . <p> A Tombstone Committee of Vigilance badge was also a fake for the simple reason that there was no organization called the Tombstone Committee of Vigilance . <p> A Bowie knife allegedly belonging to Johnny Ringo and photo were obvious phonies . The photo looked nothing like Johnny Ringo and his only possessions were taken from his body at the time he committed suicide . They were recorded by the coroner in detail and listed in the coroner 's report dated July 14 , 1882 . The only knife listed was " 1 small pocket knife . " No large Bowie knife was inventoried . <p> A purported Grant County Jail envelope , containing property supposedly belonging to Billy the Kid , was also a very amateurish fake and appears to have been done @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ signed by Billy the Kid . This was sold at auction in 2003 by California auctioneer John Gangel , but when its authenticity was questioned , Mr. Gangel submitted the documents to a forensic chemist who determined that the ink used was not invented until 1960 . This case was written up at length in Maine Antiques Digest and can be found posted on the web . I am confident that a similar ink test on this jail envelope will yield the same result . This item was removed from the auction . <p> Several wood signs for Fly 's Gallery , Texas Rangers , and Pima County Sheriff were all obviously made by the same person . They were so badly done they are laughable . <p> A silver whiskey flask , bearing a presentation to General George A. Custer from his wife , Libby , was offered . Not only did the flask contain modern style engraving , why would any proper Victorian woman give her husband something to carry whiskey in ? Why would Libby Custer want her husband to be drunk in an Indian fight ? @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ , he hired a Denver company named EMTEC which " authenticated " the engraving as being from the 19th century . Their expertise for giving such an opinion is unknown , but if EMTEC is really an expert firm , it seems odd that they were unaware that the same engraver did most of the engraving . <p> There were dozens more phony items in this auction . I could go on and on but I think I have made my point . I previously expressed my concerns that Lang Spraggins has been duped by a highly dishonest person or persons who sold him these items . It appears that Mr. Spraggins , in his enthusiasm for collecting western Americana , has been defrauded on a massive scale . Now , the gullible bidders who bought these items are the losers . Already collectors are planning to keep the auction catalog as a ready reference to identify the items should they come back on the market , as they invariably will . And in a broader sense , all of us who love our western history and heritage are damaged @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ . <p> I understand your concern in not describing the badges . I have a special police badge that was used in Madison in the 1920 's 30 's . I am aquainted with the scroll badge you described and have a copy ... more <p> There 's a photo alleged to be of Virgil while he was Marshal of Tombstone in Michael Hickey 's Cowboy Conspiracy book ( page 38 ) from the Texas Ranger Hall of Fame Museum . To my eyes it does n't look like ... more <p> The photo I am referring to is of him as a constable . I saw this picture in the Western Heritage museum years ago . I was told that it was Virgil wearing the scroll badge .. I do have the pic here ... more <p> Kevin -- Thanks . The incredible postscript is this : Stephen Reed , the misguided former mayor of Harrisburg , PA , bought many fake items from Lang Spraggins and the crooked dealers who shilled for him . ... more 
@@2907618 <p> Mike was one of that exclusive group we call the Last of The Few . Sadly , getting smaller , it seems , by the day . <p> I read that Mike saw quite a bit of action including Battle of France-Dunkirk and the Battle of Britain before getting shot down on Battle of Britain Day-September 15th , 1940 . Just 75 years ago this year . Mike took part in the Battle of France and the operations over Dunkirk in May 1940 , where he probably destroyed a Ju87 . He fought on with 213 Squadron throughout the Battle of Britain , scoring three further victories at the height of the battle in August 1940 . He was shot down as related on 15.09.40 whilst attacking a bomber , when he was hit himself by canon fire , from a defending Messerschmitt . Later he was commissioned in 1942 , his fighter pilot experience led him to spending six years as an instructor , teaching future fighter pilots that needed experience , just as Pippas father did . <p> The Kent Battle of Britain Museum posted this tribute @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ with No.213 Squadron in the Battle of Britain , passed on Thursday 15th January 2015 . Mike Croskell joined the RAFVR in June 1938 as an Airmen under training Pilot and was awarded his ' wings ' in August 1939 . He was posted to No.213 Squadron at Wittering on 26th January 1940 . Flt/Lt . Mike Croskell made several claims over Dunkirk and in the early stages of the Battle of Britain . He was shot down over Maidstone on 15th September 1940 in Hurricane Mk.I Serial No.P3113 and was forced to bale out . This Hurricane was the former mount of Squadron Leader Duncan S. MacDonald , the Commanding Officer of No.213 Squadron and carried the code letters of AK- ! ! ! . The three exclamation marks related to the three enemy aircraft that MacDonald had claimed.After attending an Instructor 's Course at CFS Upavon in February 1941 , Mike Croskell spent the remainder of the war as an instructor.Our thoughts and sympathy go out to his family at this difficult time.Sadly , and as far as we are aware , we have less than thirty Battle @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ important and critical , to commemorate their outstanding deeds so future generations can admire , learn of and more importantly remember them .... <p> I read about Mike Croskell in many Battle of Britain books like Scramble by Norman Gelb , Battle of Britain Day , by Dr. Alfred Price , and others . <p> Here were his own words from Hurricane-the last Witnesses , by Brian Milton : <p> Mike Croskell was early into the fight : " On August 11 , flying with 213 Hurricane Squadron , I chased a Junkers 88 and got a good old burst of shot into it . The chaps got out of it , sat on the wing and then slid off with their parachutes , which opened , and the aircraft went down . " Then I got tied up with five 109s , all chasing around in circles , until I got into the inner circle and shot the last one down . They all buzzed off but I was out of ammunition anyway . We only had 10 or 12 seconds firing . I was confident that in a @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ it . What the 109s used to do was stick the nose down good and hard , and dive down . We had the old float-chamber carburettor in those days , and the engine used to go ' phut when you stuck the nose down . Until we got the new carburettor we could not really follow them . " <p> And this : <p> On September 15 came one of the heaviest days of fighting in the whole battle . It is now recognised as " Battle of Britain Day " . Mike Croskell was shot down , although with an unexpected silver lining to a near-death experience . " I went out and found a lone Dornier flying towards the docks in London . I did n't  get right down into the best position to have a shot at it , and all of a sudden there were three or four loud bangs behind me . These two Bf 109s had put four explosive cannon shells into me . These shells were a deadly weapon we did n't  have anything like that , they were very effective most @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ out of control . " I went down and down and down and could n't get out , could n't get the hood open because the cannon shells jammed it . Eventually , in desperation , I undid my belt , crouched on the seat with both feet , and pulled with both hands . All of a sudden it came open and I was flung out . I seemed to be only 200ft 61m up , and the parachute opened as I hit the ground . A copse of young trees broke my fall . I had not the foggiest idea where I was . " I just had a good swear , and was found there by some New Zealand anti-aircraft blokes . I was bleeding all over the place , particularly in the left foot . They were determined to cut my shoe off but , being a mean Yorkshireman , I said , ' No , you 're not going to. While I was arguing , they cut the other shoe off . And then I got whipped into hospital and was there for three or four weeks . @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ " All these years later I can not have an MRI scan because there are still too many bits of metal in me . They are small bits , but I also have bits in the back of my knee and my foot and my shoulder . I also can not have an operation to remove the shrapnel in my head because two of the bits are too near my brain which probably accounts for a lot . " But while my mates continued with the Battle of Britain , I chatted up the Nursing Sister , Mollie Davies , married her , and lived happily ever after . " <p> Also , in connection with 213 Sqn , 1940-just last week the wife of former Battle of Britain ace ( Sgt. R . T. Llewellyn ) from 213 Squadron died . Mike would have possibly known him and also her from 1940 . We put tributes to her over several websites and forums , facebook and Twitter also . I was able to arrange for her and Stephen Llewellyn to go to Westminster Abbey for the Battle of Britain @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ they did not know that they were able to go and to sit also with the veteran Battle of Britain pilots , as relatives . <p> It is an honour to have met and talked with some of these men . I was not lucky enough to meet Mike , but enjoyed reading his accounts in many books of the Battle of Britain . <p> Rest in peace , Sir . We all owe you a debt of gratitude . The last time I met Mike Croskell , was at Shoreham back in 2006 . I remember him giving Geoff ( curator of the Museum ) a right earful . We were ... more

@@2907621 <p> If anyone could help with official documentation on the children of Thomas MackGehee , b. 1655 , York County , Virginia , d . Title : Ann HintonText : " Burke 's Peerage and Baronetage agrees with Browning in making Marian MacDonald the wife of Patrick MacGregor but calls her a daughter of MacDonald of @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ goes on to say that Patrick 's sons were : John the heir ; James , a major in the army who settled in America ; and Duncan , who died unmarried . Further it was not John the heir of Patrick who adopted the name John Murray , but a son of John 's flourishing in 1715 at the time of the Jacobite uprising . As for James , nothing is said about his having become Thomas MackGehee , and indeed he must have been born too early to have survived until 1727 as the father of Thomas MackGehee 's children , three who were under age at the date of his will . In view of Burke 's statement that James MacGregor was a major in the army combined with the following words by Sir Iian Moncreiffe of the Ilk , Albany Herald , in his The Highland Clans : " To get away from it all , in the mid seventeenth century one brother of the then chieftan of the Children of the Mist emigrated to America , WHERE HE WAS SCALPED BY THE LONG ... Kevin @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ 31THE LAST WILL AND TESTAMENTOFTHOMAS MACK GEHEEIn the name of God Amen . I , Thomas Mack Gehee , of St. John 's Parish , King William county , being sick and weak , but of perfect mind and memory , do call to mind the uncertainty of this life and here make my last will and testament . First , I commend my soul into the hands of Almighty God , my merciful Redeemer , hoping through his mercy to obtain an everlasting crown of glory , my body to be decently buried , and all my just and principal debts to be paid.I bequeath as here followeth : Item 1st . I give and bequeath to my son , William Mack Gehee , ten shillings to buy him a mourning ring , being in full of his portion . Item 2nd . I give and bequeath to my daughter , Anna Butler , ten shillings to buy her a mourning ring , being in full of her portion . Item 3rd . I give and bequeath to my son-in-law , John Lipscomb , and my daughter Dinah , @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ , being in full of their portion . Item 4th . I give and bequeath to my son , Abraham Mack Gehee , ninety-six acres of land , being in part of the dividend of land I now live on , with the houses , orchards and appurtenances belonging thereunto , to him and his heirs forever . Item 5th . I give and bequeath to my son Abraham Mack Gehee , one negro man named Bristol , to him and his heirs forever ; also one feather bed and furniture , and one large chest . And it is my further will and testament that when my two sons , Jacob and Samuel , and my daughter , Sarah , come of age , that my said son , Abraham , do pay them five pounds each . 7 . Title : Kevin McGeheeText : Will continued:Item 6th . I give and bequeath to my son , Edward Mack Gehee , fifty acres of land , of the same dividend of land I now live on , belonging to my said plantation , also one negro man named Peter @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ paying to my sons , Samuel and Jacob , and my daughter , Sarah , when they arrive at the age of twenty one years , five pounds each . I also give and bequeath to my son , Edward Mack Gehee , one feather bed and furniture and the chest which was his mother 's . Item 7th . I give and bequeath to my son , Samuel Mack Gehee , fifty acres of land , being part of the same dividend of land I now live on , also one feather bed and furniture , and one large chest , to him and his heirs forever . I likewise give and bequeath to my son , Samuel , my riding mare , saddle and bridle . Item 8th . I give and bequeath to my son , Jacob Mack Gehee , fifty acres of land , one large chest , to him and his heirs forever . My further will and desire is that my son , Jacob , shall live with my son , Abraham Mack Gehee , and when he arrives at the age of eighteen @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ case my said son , Jacob , works with him . My further will and desire is that my said land , so given , to be divided among my children , to be laid out crosswise , beginning at Neckatewanna bridge up the head line to the corner , and down the back line until it includes Abraham 's portion of ninety-six acres , and so the list of my sons ' parts to be laid out in this course until they each have their complement . 8 . Title : Kevin McGeheeText : Will continued:Item 9th . I give and bequeath to my daughter , Sarah , one feather bed and furniture , one chest of drawers , and one sealskin trunk . And it is my further will and desire that after my decease my said daughter , Sarah , be paid by my executors five pounds in current money or goods from a store , that is to say , the first year after my decease , fifty shillings , and the following fifty shillings more . And I give and bequeath unto my said daughter @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ bridle . Item 10th . I give and bequeath to my daughter , Mary Dickson , one bed filled with feathers , a pair of blankets , my desk and all that is in the desk . My further will and desire is that my draught mare and hogs be and remain on the plantation for the support and maintenance of my children . My cattle and sheep and hogs I desire to be equally divided among my five youngest children . Also , the last of my personal estate , likewise by lots , be equally divided among the same . I do constitute my loving sons , Abraham , Edward and Samuel Mack Gehee , my whole and sole executors of this my last will and testament , revoking and making void and disannulling all wills by me before made . In witness whereof I have set my hand and affixed my seal this twenty seventh day of July , in the year of our Lord , seventeen hundred and twenty four . Thomas Mack GeheeSigned and sealed in thepresence of us:Robert Bainbridge W. Craddock J. @@2907624 <p> Erowid Note : This article is archived for historical purposes and should be understood as one person 's view/rant and not a well-researched factual account . It contains errors and unsubstantiated claims that the reader should consider carefully before citing as source material . <p> Here at the end of the millennium , the pace of modern life seems fleeting -- a whirl of minutes , hours and days . In dealing with the changes , humans have equipped themselves with the tools to move faster , more efficiently . <p> At the same time a dependence for the marketing , high-speed transportation and pharmacology of this modern age has evolved . In a race to outdo ourselves , we have moved dangerously toward the fine line between extinction and evolution . Therefore , the human capacity to handle the velocity becomes a fragile balance . <p> Our generation ( see Gen X , 20-somethings ) could be considered the sleepless generation . An age of society 's children weaned on the ideals of high-speed communication and accelerated culture has prided itself in mastering many of the facets of @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ The machines of this age have in a way enabled us to create a 24-hour lifestyle . We have pushed the limits of the modern world further -- ATMs , high-speed modems , smart bombs and bullet trains . However , the limitations of human existence , like sleep , may still provide the stumbling block for infinite realization . That is , without chemical aid . <p> In many ways , capitalism fuels the idea . Our society is based upon the mass consumption of these substances . Cultural ideals , while seemingly benevolent as " Have a Coke and a smile " have sold the link to chemical substances like caffeine and nicotine to " the good life . " Today , stimulants are the bedrock for consumer culture . For our generation , this appeal was heightened by raising the stakes in the ' 80s on what it meant to have fun . <p> Late night clubs , high speed music and 24-hour lifestyles brought the specter of drugs to the fold as a necessity for being able to attain more . Leaps away from the psychedelics @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ stimulant drugs became tools -- utilitarian devices to gain wealth , intelligence and prestige . Sleep became a barrier for success . Dreams were the frivolous luxuries of childhood . <p> Raves , founded equally in the post-conservative underground late- ' 80s and the chaotic early- ' 90s , are part of the pastiche that has consequently become more dream-like , more unreal and still somehow manageable . The hyperreality of today goes hand in hand with the drugs being administered . <p> It 's 6 a.m . Around the speaker bins are small packs of animated dancers grinding their feet into the floor and shaking their hands in front of them . The lookie-loos and weekend warriors have long since gone home . <p> Absent from their faces are the smiles of midnight , replaced by the blank , vacant stare of sleepless dreams . They have a name in the rave community , they are " tweakers . " " Tweaking , " the common name for sniffing lines of speed , the drug methamphetamine , ( popular for its availability and price ) has somehow replaced MDMA @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ the clear head and stamina to keep dancing long after their bodies have gone to sleep . <p> A prominent opinion during the aftermath of the Los Angeles Summer of Love was that speed killed the rave scene . Where speed had been seen in every scene from metal to the punk scene , for some reason it was shocking for some to see methamphetamine take hold , even though MDMA ( an amphetamine-like substance ) had been circulating for years . <p> Some likened the rise to the quash of young newcomers , some equated it with the greed of drug dealers . Judging from today 's roster of events throughout the nation , raves are still alive and well . However , many old-schoolers have been turned off by the newbie vibe that came with speed 's rise in popularity . Some were casualties themselves of the drug 's addictive nature . Others say that speed alone is what fuels the rave scene , keeping it from dying . <p> Amphetamine was first synthesized in 1887 . First popularized by pharmaceutical company Smith Kline &amp; French as the @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ is widely known as a bronchio dialator , allowing asthmatics to breathe more freely . ) A probable direct reaction to the Depression and Prohibition , the drug was used and abused by non-asthmatics looking for a buzz . Jazz great Charlie " Bird " Parker would remove the inhaler 's Benzedrine strip and soak it in his coffee . <p> Methamphetamine , more potent and easy to make , was discovered in Japan in 1919 . The crystalline powder was soluble in water , making it a perfect candidate for injection . <p> Also smoking the drug creates a similar rush . It is still legally produced in the U.S. , most often prescribed for weight loss , sold under the trade name Desoxyn . As the name " speed " suggests , amphetamines elevate mood , heighten endurance and eliminate fatigue , explaining the drug 's popularity with the military . Hitler was supposedly injected with methamphetamine . <p> Speed rose to popularity in California , home of many of the largest meth labs in the country , riding on the back of biker gangs . Bikers have @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ ' 60s , subsequently bringing down a whole Summer of Love with violence and angst . Since then , speed has been given a bad rap . It has been called a trailer park drug for decades , due to the fact that it can be cooked up so cheaply and easily . <p> It 's the drug of choice for long-distance truckers and college students pulling all-nighters . Over the counter ephedrine , or " white crosses , " has taken the place of pharmaceutical amphetamine as an easy-to-get alternative . <p> What is often misunderstood is the relationship between speed and crystal meth . The common reference to speed in the rave scene is the methamphetamine salt ( HCl powder ) , whereas " crystal " usually refers to the free-base form of methamphetamine . Erowid Note : This is incorrect . Freebase methamphetamine is an oil at room temperature and all available powder and crystal forms of methamphetamine are salts . <p> Another form " Ice , " a higher-grade , purer form of crystal meth is smoked , a single hit creates a high that lasts @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ days . Erowid Note : <p> This is incorrect . Methamphetamine is a pure chemical , although retail forms may contain various adulterants , binders , or fillers . The ice/glass forms of methamphetamine are often less adulterated forms of methamphetamine , but its dosages are the same as any pure methamphetamine dosages and its effects are identical when taken at the same dose , through the same route of ingestion , as other forms of methamphetamine . <p> However , its high price prevents it from taking hold . A gram of " ice " commands about $5,000 on the street . Erowid Note : This is incorrect . Although anyone can pay any price in a free market , as of 2003 , methamphetamine 's street price has never been that high . Prices for methamphetamine between 1992 and 2003 generally ranged from $50-200 per gram . The price the author cites would put the cost of a single dose at $250-500 USD , a full order of magnitude higher than prices paid for single doses in high-priced New York City clubs . <p> Speed came to the @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ in ' 92 started to get really good , the police were cracking down more on the prime-time parties -- partiers needed to find late-night/early morning activities like after-hours . Consequently , the price of taking 3-4 pills of ecstasy became too expensive an option , speed took over as an easier to get and cheaper alternative . Now , the standard street price in Los Angeles for a gram of speed is approximately $100 , where ecstasy sells for approx. $150 or more . <p> One major misconception is the link between methamphetamine and ecstasy MDMA . Ecstasy does not necessarily contain speed , yet both contain the methamphetamine structure . However , each affects a far different region of the brain resulting in different psychological effects . <p> Ecstasy primarily effects serotonin in the brain -- the center for self-satisfaction and emotional systems . Speed affects dopamine primarily , a neurotransmitter linked to pleasure and reward . ( Oddly , alcohol also affects a dopamine center . ) Often , MDMA is " cut " with speed to lower the street price of the drug , thus changing @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ chemical makeup but one can not be made from the other . Slightly changing the chemical makeup produces a wholly different effect in the human brain . While both have addictive potential , speed , because of its dopamine ties , is much more profoundly addicting . Qualitatively , speed and ecstasy supposedly give off " glows " that are far different . <p> Ecstasy has a definite link to the rave scene . In some places it is synonymous . Speed too has been linked to the rave scene -- some say it was the death of the ideal . What 's unusual , given the qualitative similarities between the two , are the differing opinions about speed . While many admit openly to taking MDMA , they will not condone or even accept speed as a " valid " recreational drug . The stigma that goes with " tweaking " can be quite severe . <p> " Speed is evil , " says Dominic . " I have seen more people 's lives twisted up off that drug than anything else in the world . I was first @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ I was dating . I basically watched her use of it turn from an occasional party thing to basically the sustenance of her life . Her body withered way , and everything she did revolved around speed . " <p> " Speed does not belong in the underground scene , " he continues . " Something that is so damn negative could never co-exist with the positive ideals that we try to promote . If you want to get amped , feel energy and stay up all night , try alternatives -- using speed just to stay up is a total cop out . " However , his opinion is that ecstasy has opposite effects and could actually save the rave scene . " MDMA induces a sense of spiritual enlightenment , happiness , and sometimes social understanding , something that could never be achieved by shoving a few rails of driveway cleaner up your nose . " <p> " I 'm all for consciousness expansion , even if by chemical means , " says another critic , Michael . " Preferably organic chemistry . The problem is major parts @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ betterment of the self through involvement in community . " <p> A regular user of the drug is DJ Velour , 19 , also finds some criticism for it . " I believe that speed/crystal is one of the most psychologically addictive drugs around , " he says " Whenever I get tired or wish I had more energy , <p> I always think how nice it would be to have some speed . In that respect , I am addicted , because it is definitely a part of my thought pattern now . And I have n't done speed for over 3 weeks now . " Even though his experiences have not all been good , he is still connected to the drug . <p> " Amphetamines , in my mind are not evil , " says Velour , hoping to defend the drug against his critical peers . " They are simple chemicals , if there is anything evil it is the society we live in which dictates that they are illegal and thus makes them harder to get . " <p> " I will admit one thing @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ . " Once you take it a few times , you will continue to think about it after you stop . I have n't done speed for a month now and still some days will go by where I have only had 3 or 4 hours sleep , and I think to myself , <p> ' You know , speed would really help out right now . ' However , that is what makes me a more responsible user . I not only realize my desire for speed and other amphetamines and I curb the habit . " He feels that his ability to control his habit is more powerful than his lust for it . <p> " Many of my friends are long time users of speed . However , by no means have they ruined their lives . " <p> DJ Velour believes that the rave community can co-exist with a drug like methamphetamine . He also , among others , mentions speed 's many different appearances that make for different psychological outcomes . " Speed and other stimulants can be a positive part of a raving community @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ depends upon the person taking it and the purity/mixture of the drug . As strange as this may sound , different speeds can evoke different emotions . <p> They not only stimulate latent emotions , increasing their strength , but they can also enforce emotions much in the way ecstasy can . I have had some very " happy " speed that made me feel as happy as when I was on X. On the flip side I have had some lower grade speed that made me feel depressed . " <p> Speedlore and Methology : Part I <p> " Of all the separate realities , legal landscapes , and metabolic metropolis that thrive beneath the surface of the Cleaver 's USA , no subculture seems as pervasive or uniform as the nationwide-eyed , high dosage methamphetamine club . <p> This group is a tribute to the idea that some things stay the same across time or space ... the members come and go , some leave quietly , some go snitch , croak , or disappear , some hang in there after their lights have gone out , and @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ Friday morning by blue windbreakers with yellow writing . <p> Getting in too deep is what we do , it 's who we are . <p> But despite all this , there are a few of us who have managed to hang around the periphery for decades , avoiding the felonies , gunshots , big ripoffs , and crippling motorcycle accidents . <p> Other than luck , the key to staying alive is knowing when to take a step back , on your own , and avoid the biggest bear-trap in the speed circus : taking yourself too seriously ... <p> Truly not giving a ... is the only way to maintain perspective . In other words , there are worse things that can happen , than having to lay down and go to sleep for a week ... no drug or state of mind is worth dying for , killing for , or doing hard time for ... " ( Speed Phreak )

@@2907633 <h> YourWebApps.com Privacy Policy <p> YourWebApps.com recognizes that its customers need to know YourWebApps.com will respect and protect the privacy of information placed in a YourWebApps.com WebApp or GroupApp . This document describes how YourWebApps.com safeguards your privacy and treats personal information . We understand that for you to take full advantage of the benefits of this interactive medium , we must do what we can to ensure that your privacy is secure . <p> 1 . We do not disclose the information placed in your WebApp or GroupApp . <p> YourWebApps.com honors the confidentiality of its customers ' private information placed in a WebApp or GroupApp . We are required by law to disclose information under certain , limited , circumstances , and you should keep this in mind when posting information to your WebApp or GroupApp . <p> a ) YourWebApps.com reserves the right to reveal data in cooperation with a request or investigation by any governmental body or governmental agency , or in response to a subpoena issued by any governmental body or governmental agency ; <p> b ) YourWebApps.com reserves the right to examine any data @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ third party that a Customer or Visitor is using a WebApp or GroupApp in connection with an infringing , illegal or improper activity or that the data infringes rights of the third party . <p> c ) YourWebApps.com reserves the right to disclose the identity of a Customer , or information allowing identification of a Customer , in response to request for identification in connection with claim of Copyright or Trademark infringement by the Customer . <p> d ) Information posted or uploaded by Customers may be stored on computers maintained by and in control of YourWebApps.com 's Service Provider . Any expectation of privacy by a Customer is limited by and subject to the scope of the Service Provider 's privacy policy <p> We have three exceptions to this policy . We will release specific information about your account to law enforcement authorities if compelled to by legal process . We will provide identification information in response to a request for identification in connection with a claim of Copyright or Trademark infringement by a Customer . We may from time to time share aggregate registration information ( such as @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ , trial over , etc. ) with our partners ( whom are under confidentiality obligations ) . However , since we make no commitments on behalf of our partners , we do encourage you to acquaint yourself with their individual privacy policies as well . <p> 3 . We use secure technology , privacy protection controls , and restrictions on employee access in order to safeguard your personal information . <p> We use industry-standard technology to keep your personal information and your billing and account information as secure as possible . We also have put in place privacy protection control systems designed to ensure that your personal data remain safe and private . <p> Every Server Company employee is obligated to abide by the YourWebApps.com privacy policy . Employees who violate our privacy policies are subject to disciplinary action , up to and including termination . <p> Only authorized Server Company employees servicing YourWebApps.com , and employees of our Service Provider , are permitted to have access to your personal information and such access is limited by need . <p> We encourage our partners to clearly post their own privacy @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ contact them directly if you have any questions . <p> We use third-party advertising companies to serve ads when you visit our website . Our third-party advertising companies also separately place or recognize a cookie file on your browser in the course cookie on your browser . <p> If you 'd like to comment on or have questions about our privacy policy , have a concern or policy violation you wish to report , or wish to change or delete the customer information you submitted to YourWebApps.com , please contact Customer Support at support@yourwebapps.com or by calling 617-249-0755. 
@@2907634 <p> Everyone has a right to health , wealth , well being , peace , happiness and freedom . If you also believe in this , then I wish you Happy Holidays . Visual Ray Psionics <p> I never actually finished the paper on Visual Ray Psionics . It 's a ' spooky ' paper that deals with thought forms , the way we create them , and how the Visual Ray works . The paper kept getting longer because I was always finding more information ; it was turning into a thesis . I might write a book on it because this subject is so prolific . <p> Here we are years later because I have been wanting to continue the subject within the context of a forum such as this . I 'm so glad you could join me in my continuation of this paper as I continue this article . <p> Let 's establish some experience in our minds before we begin . We understand and learn through experience , so I 'm hoping that I am dealing with a sensitive group . <p> The Visual Ray <p> The visual ray @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ . Are you familiar with the aura ? It 's been proven to exist using Kirlian Photography . The aura is the interactive culmination of energy fields generated in the body ; technically it 's a meissner field since it contains a plethora of electromagnetic and scalar components ( mostly scalar ) . Suffice it to say that this is a ray of biological energy which has many implications in itself . <p> ( A scalar is pure potential that manifests itself as a vector force when combined with a similar potential in terms of scalar wave interferometry . ) Theoretically , the microtubule network within the cytoskeleton of the neurons generate a specific aura according to our mood and Temperament as a reflection of the chakra system at any given moment . For example , aura detectors see dark red for anger indicating lower chakrum activation as opposed to upper chakra like violet for peace and well being . <p> This same microtubule network generates a soliton field during higher levels of consciousness which is scalar in nature . The soliton field is an integral layer of the meissner @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ what creates " chemistry " in terms of resonance or incompatibility in terms of dissonance . In fact , it 's a bioresonant energy field . <p> Psionics <p> Psionics , like radionics , operates on the principle that every point in space and time has a unique vibratory rate of resonance . The tuning in this case is specifically between minds and thought-forms . As in radionics , an external device can be used to help hold the resonant frequency , but the actual crux of the tuning mechanism is still the mind . <p> Visual Ray Psionics is thought form projection , in a nutshell ; it is an etheric function that creates reality from the universal ether ( all the Michelson-Morley experiment proved is that the ether is not electromagnetic in nature ) . When we look at someone we are sending information to that person . Have you ever tried to avoid someone at a party or even on the street ? You keep looking at this person hoping that he/she does n't notice you , then , somehow , that person notices you out of @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ that you were there using your visual ray of which the cosmic ether is a carrier . <p> This information is holographic in nature . Strangely enough , this means that psychoenergetic information can be transferred in a split second to anyone and passed around like a special piece of candy between people . The Yang Ming Temperament <p> There are six major Temperaments according to Traditional Chinese Medical Theory . These Temperaments go hand in hand with the personality dimensions cited by Alan Tutt , yet these Temperaments are more precise since they are specific to the overall mind-pattern as it relates to the bioenergetic makeup of the individual in question . <p> If you have studied Kuji Kiri Mind Control according to Ashida Kim , then you know that you can telepathically affect certain changes @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ precise according to their Temperament . <p> The reason I 'm going to cover the Yang Ming Temperament right now is that it is directly controlled by the Governing Vessel ( aka the sea of yang meridians ) ; it is one of the two most important vessels trained in chi kung and aids in balancing and controlling mind patterns or Temperaments related to its function . <p> The description extracted here is taken from the english translation of Yves Requena 's Character and Health , The Relationship of Acupuncture and Psychology : " Yang Ming is the name given to the meridians of the large intestine and stomach ... <p> " In practice , the two types ( constitutions of sanguine and phlegmatic ) are often mixed in persons of Yang Ming Temperament , but one can encounter more or less pure sanguine and pure phlegmatic , or clear cases of one dominating the other . It is therefore useful to analyze the two types separately ... <p> " Yang Ming-earth : <p> " Intellectual Behaviour : Yang Ming-earth persons have a good memory . They use mnemonic devices @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ association of ideas and sonorities , and puns . They like songs with refrains , proverbs , popular sayings , farce , gallant stories , and lecheries . <p> " Psychological Behaviour : The Yang Ming-earth type corresponds to the non-emotive type ; this is the first of the four non-emotive character types ... The person also is active and primary ... <p> Yang Ming-earth person are extroverts who dedramatize everything by the absense of emotivity . Their conflicts are lived as a game . With the hyperactivity and dynamism they take pleasure in vanguishing obstacles . They are inclined to be objective , have their feet on the ground and exercise good practical sense . Their sense of practicality moves them to find ingenious solutions to problems . <p> " Extroverted , they like human contact more than anything else , meeting with friends , joining clubs for fishing and hunting . They will play their favourite games and at the same time tell story after story . Theyare the life of the party . But they are also coureous and worldly , and enjoy the rules of good @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ them greaty success . They have qualities of diplomacy , and they are endowed with the greatest tolerance . Added to their tactical sense , they have the capacity to manage others well ... " <p> This work by Requena also indicates physiognomy ; this means you can spot a Temperament just by looking at them exactly because of the way their bioenergetics work . In the case of Yang Ming-earch for example : " The face is round , open affable , jovial , welcoming . The lips are often fleshy and full . The complexion is frankly red , even apoplectic . Blotchiness can settle in at an early age , or there will be a clear redness at the tip of the nose , the earlobes , or the whole ear , indicating from youth the vascular aspect of the temperament . The expression is mild , the eyes a bit globular like a doe or oxen , joyous , laughing , or even malicious . But at the same time the expression radiates benevolence , a reassuring and paternal energy . With age , the Yang @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ top of the head . <p> There is a tendency in this constitution to overheating of the stomach yang . Such person dread not only humidity but also heat , which overwhelms them or leaves them sleepy . They thus dread the summer . In terms of foods , these individuals like everything from dishes with sauces to desserts . Sweets are a favourite . They do not always salt their food , but willingly sweeten their desserts and cofee ... " <p> I do n't know about you , but I 'd swear that Requena is describing Santa Clause . Try spotting these characteristics in your boss or the " life of the party " at your next social event . Then use the Alan Tutt methods of building rapport with them using the above personality dimensions of the Yang Ming-earth temperament . Winter , especially around the holidays , is a good time of year for this temperament since they love to socialise and this is their favourite weather , so this is a good time to spot them . <h> 5 . At the outbreak of the war JG 2 was tasked @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ area under Luftgaukommando III . Stab and II . Gruppe were equipped with the Bf 109E and were located at Dberitz with 10 . This Gruppe gained the Luftwaffes first night kill over the RAF Bomber Command on the night of 25/26 on April 1940 when Ofw Frster shot down a Handley Page Hampden . <p> The unit saw little combat until the Western offensive against France and the Low Countries from 10 May 1940 onwards . During the campaign against France , JG 2 was tasked with escorting raids and defending German airspace to the south of Heinz Guderian 's Panzer forces which were encircling the French and the British Expeditionary Force further north . Leutnant Helmut Wick , who later became part of a trio of outstanding aces ( including Adolf Galland from Jagdgeschwader 26 ( JG 26 ) and Werner Mlders from Jagdgeschwader @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ Britain , attained his first and the Geschwader 's second kill on 22 November 1939 , a French Curtiss Hawk Model 75 . The first victory for the JG 2 was scored by Oberfeldwebel Kley ( 3 . Staffel ) at the same day . <p> JG 2 took part in the Battle of Britain , operating Bf 109Es over the South Coast of England and the English Channel from bases in Cherbourg and Normandy . Major Helmut Wick emerged as one of the Battles top Luftwaffe aces , claiming 31 kills for a personal total of 56 , before being killed ( MIA ) in action versus Spitfires of No. 609 Squadron in November 1940 . Wick was seen to bail out successfully but was not found by German Air/Sea Rescue attempts . The Spitfire who dispatched him was immediately shot down by Oberleutnant Rudolf Pflanz . Ofw . The practice is called bacha bazi , literally " boy play , " and American soldiers and Marines have been instructed not to intervene in some cases , not even when their Afghan allies have abused boys on military bases , according to interviews and court records . <p> The policy has endured as American forces have recruited and organized Afghan militias to help hold territory against the Taliban . But soldiers and Marines have been increasingly troubled that instead of weeding out pedophiles , the American military was arming them in some cases and placing them as the commanders of villages and doing little when they began abusing children . <p> " The reason we were here is because we heard the terrible things the Taliban were doing to people , how they were taking @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ former Special Forces captain who beat up an American-backed militia commander for keeping a boy chained to his bed as a sex slave . But I know had I ever witnessed it myself , and been in a position to do something , I also would have been forced out . But the fact that career military are losing their commands over it sends my blood pressure sky rocketing . <p> UPDATE : 9/24/2015 <p> So I 've had a day or so to calm down , and ...... well , I have n't calmed down one bit . In fact , I 'm angrier than I was before . Two videos to give you an idea of what is happening to SFC Martland : <p> That is from about a month ago . This is from yesterday : <p> I will mention a few things here . The first is that I saw some Twitter chatter blaming this on the current White House and their policies . I know my defense wo n't change a @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ happening during the first Bush administration back in 2004 . So I do n't put any stock in that argument . Before he was SEC ARMY , McHugh was a Congressman from upstate New York ( near Fort Drum ) and I testified before him several times when I was a lobbyist . I found him to be a great guy . I frankly ca n't come up with any scenario where this is a smart take . <p> Either way , we are about to have a new Secretary of the Army , as President Obama the other day nominated a new person : <p> President Barack Obama announced his intent Friday to nominate seven individuals to key administration posts , included among those is Eric K. Fanning , who will be nominated for the @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ role as acting undersecretary of the Army , Fanning has served as special assistant to Defense Secretary Ash Carter since March 2015 . He also served as chief of staff to the secretary from March to June 2015 . <p> " Eric served as my first chief of staff at the Pentagon , and it has been a privilege over the course of my career to work alongside him and watch him develop into one of our country 's most knowledgeable , dedicated , and experienced public servants , " Carter said . " I know he will strengthen our Army , build on its best traditions , and prepare our ground forces to confront a new generation of challenges . <p> " President Obama has made an excellent choice , and I hope for a quick Senate confirmation , " Carter said . <p> Most of the news reports seem to center on Fanning 's sexual orientation , but seemingly lost in the shuffle here is the fact he never spent a day in the military . I hope the new Secretary if confirmed can understand the plight of @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ have the luxury of 20/20 hindsight , but have to deal with the realities they face in real time . <p> I had a Sergeant in Bosnia , SSG Miller , who every day reminded us that to be a good soldier you only needed to remember one immutable fact : Always take the hard right over the easy wrong . <p> Well , SFC Martand did just that , and now he 's being kicked out . @@2907638 <p> A " Split-Arsed pilot " or to refer to a " split-arse turn " was a reference from way back to the first combats and aerobatics when tight turns when flying " By the seat of your pants " was the norm . This was also known as Splitarsing around in combat or in Aerobatics . This is due to the effect on your errr , base ( ? ) , you know the word , Arse , as it slides around on the seat due to sideways pressure . <p> There are more modern terminologies now with Jets and also talk of rate 1 , rate 2 , rate 3 and so on turns ie Rate 1 turn . <p> I can only relate what it feels like having been in a Slingsby T67M Firefly with Bill Prest , an ex RAF jet instructor and thenan aerobatic instructor . He pulled , according to my certificate some 5.5 G in some tight " Split-Arse turns " and -2 Negative G. In reality the Accelerometre ( G-metre ) showed 7.6 but as the aircraft was rated to plus 9 @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ said to me that if the reading was registered on my documents , and by agreement , in his aircraft log , then he would have had to put the aircraft U/S for the day whilst a Certificate of Airworthiness was carried out or some invasive and intensive checks , therefore holding up the other charity event riders as I was . I did get to turn , not too tight , around Blackpool Tower , which was a thrill . This came back to mind on seeing one of the Red Arrows singletons streak past ina " Split Arse turn " and jink right behind the crowded sea front on Sunday . <p> Below is a peice taken from the combat account of a WW1 pilot who shot down the German ace Erwin Boehme , in this he describes , eloquently , the first meaning of a split-arse turn and what a split arse pilot could do withh a machine in flight , also known as Split-arsing all over the sky , or in desperate tight turning combat ; Then , on 29 November , Bhme took off on @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ Sopwith Camel earlier that day . Now he and his five strong flight spotted a Royal Flying Corps Armstrong Whitworth F.K.8 of No. 10 Squadron on a photo-reconnaissance mission near Zonnebeke , Belgium . Veteran pilot Captain John Patten should have been preparing for home leave , but had decided to fly one more mission . In the back seat of their photographic reconnaissance plane , Lieutenant Philip Leychester manned the camera and the gun . Patten tells the story : <p> " Suddenly , I heard the clatter of Leycester 's machine gun above the roar of the engine . I looked round to see what he was shooting at , and nearly had a heart attack . Slanting down from above , getting nicely into position thirty yards behind my tail , was an Albatros . " I immediately heaved the old A-W round in a split-arse turn , tighter I think than I had ever turned before . I felt a flash of panic as I lost sight of the Hun , but Leycester must have been able to see him all right as he kept on @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ The Albatros overshot and suddenly appeared right in front of me . Because of the relative motion of our two aircraft , he seemed to hang motionless , suspended in mid-air . I could see the pilot 's face as he looked back at me . I sent a two-second burst of Vickers ( machine gun ) fire into him . His aircraft seemed to flutter , then slid out of sight below my starboard wing . I was pretty certain that I had hit his petrol tank . Behind me , Leycester was still blazing away . He was using tracer ( incendiary bullets ) , and it may have been one of his bullets that ignited the petrol pouring from the Hun 's ruptured tank . When I caught sight of the Albatros again , it was burning like a torch and side-slipping towards the ground , trailing a streamer of smoke . For an instant I saw the German pilot , looking down over the side of the cockpit . Then the smoke and flames enveloped him . " <p> By the way do not try to @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ split ass as you get a different meaning altogether and red cheeks1 <p> Americans say , as John Wheeler will confirm , he 2Landed on his Fanny2 meaning Bum , Arse or Bottom . @@2907645 <p> I posted this topic on another message board but sadly it got closed down for inaproprite content , luckily I was emailed the replies so I can share them here . <p> From : Yorkshire LassMessage : Forced to change in front of boys <p> I grew up in a small village in Yorkshire , we were in the middle of the country side and my jr school was the only one for miles around . It only had around 20 pupils per year meaning only one class . It was my last year in this school and having an early birthday I will have been around 11 . In my year their was only 2 girls me and another one . This was quite annoying as it meant that we never got to play netball or hockey but instead had to join in with the boys playing football or cricket . <p> Due to limited school resources we where expected to get changed in the classroom but luckily since being about 8 ( the age we started to get embarrassed about undressing in front of boys ) Me @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ to get changed . However to my horror one day in my last year I turned up and was informed that due to health and safety report from Offstead we had to be supervised while getting ready for PE and since there was no one or no room available we would have to get changed in the classroom with the boys . <p> Betty was really shy but also really quiet and did n't protest . She was lucky as was able to pull her PE shorts on under her skirt and was wearing a vest under her shirt as she was n't really developed enough for a bra . Me on the other hand started arguing with my teacher a very old and inpatient crone who saw nothing wrong with ' little children ' getting undressed together . She got mad at me telling me to hurry up and if I kept the class waiting I would have to bring me PE kit with me and get changed out on the playing field . Looking back I think this was an empty threat but suddenly I knew I had @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ my argument being followed by a collection of perverted boys in my class . Suddenly I looked around blushing as every eye was on me . They could see I was in trousers and I had also overheard a few comments about my early budding breasts and the knowledge I wore a bra . Terrified I suddenly realized I could have got it over with nice and quickly while the boys where still changing and equally as embarrassed about being seen in their undies . <p> I quickly got back to my desk right in the middle of the classroom and felt so surrounded . I remember my shaky fingers as I had to unbutton my shirt clinging to it like my life depended on it . I tried to cover myself with my PE top as I shrugged out of my smart shirt leaving my back naked aside from my bra strap . I could hear hushed whispers and giggles from the boys loving the site of an undressing girl . I looked up and saw our devil of teacher tapping her watch not caring that the boys where all having an eye full . I suddenly noticed my mistake . I was in a pair of tight school trousers that I would have to take off and this new PE shirt offered much less coverage than my smart one would have . Reluctantly I unzipped them and pulled them down my legs flashing the entire room the white and pink embarrassing cartoon panties my mum still bought me . <p> I tried to quickly remove them but got my trousers caught in my shoes that I had failed to remove in my panic .
